loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is 32 years old and married with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a restaurant and has been in the business for two years. Enid also practices farming to earn additional income. She began her business to get profits and earn a living. In spite of weather changes, she is working hard to generate income for her family. Enid wants a loan to buy food and drinks to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy food and drinks to boost her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 50-year-old widow who is blessed with four children and has been operating a farming business for ten years earning an income of 15,000 KES at the end of every month.

Josephine was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of 30,000 KES and intends to use this amount to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her farm plantation.

Josephine plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Taufik

texts.en:
Taufik lives in Cibubur, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. He is married and living with three other people in the family home: his wife, and his two children. To support his family, Taufik runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, consumer goods, electrical appliances, and mobile phone airtime credits. He began working with Ruma 7 months ago because he wanted to increase his income. 

Taufik feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Taufik is standing in front of his small stall.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 45-year-old woman married to Raphael, who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. They are blessed with three children.  

Elizabeth has been a farmer of livestock and poultry keeping as a secondary business for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Elizabeth was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000. She intends to use this amount to buy animal feed for her livestock.

Elizabeth plans to use the anticipated income to build a structural house for her poultry and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Rene Rose

texts.en:
Rene Rose is 43 years old, and has five children. She lives in Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has a fishing business and she has been managing it for more than ten years. She sells fish in bulk in boxes in the market and she earns well from this. 

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She hopes to become successful in her business as well as she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Ella's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en: Geneva is a 40-year-old single female with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a textile shop of clothes and she also owns a retail shop of general merchandise to generate additional income. She began the business in order to cater for her family's needs and look after himself as a single mother. Geneva wants money to buy shirts, dresses and other cloth (bitenge) to sell. Geneva is a hard-working woman with a dream of expanding the business and educating her children. However, she is faced with a challenge of inadequate capital so she has applied for a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy shirts, dresses and other cloth (bitenge) to sell.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is 37 years old and married, with four school-aged children.

Aquilina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF, in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Aquilina has already borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from tricycle transportation. Aquilina hopes to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zani

texts.en:
Zani is 22 years old and married with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She deals in second-hand clothes (Kikade). Zani has been in  business since 2013. She earns additional income from farming. She is a hard working woman with a dream of expanding her business, in spite of limited capital and competition.

Zani wants a loan to buy second-hand dresses, shirts, trousers, and blouses to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand dresses, shirts, trousers, and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 24 years old and married with one child and she lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

She operates a drug shop—a business she began—to be self-employed. She has a dream of expanding her business and having a brighter future. Juliet is a hardworking woman faced with the challenge of competition. 

Juliet wants money to buy more human drugs and deliver better services to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase drugs to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, aged 54 years, is a married woman and has been blessed with five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Asha has operated a retail shop, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Asha is requesting a KES 10,000 loan to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta, his wife, and their only child live in Bogor, a city located about 1 hour from Jakarta. To support their family living, Marta manages a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment service for his customers. 

Marta joined Ruma because he wanted to try out mobile airtime business. He feels really excited to expand his business into selling mobile phone airtime credits. Nowadays, he can process up to 40 transactions per day and it is expected to grow more. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Cynthia works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens. Cynthia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF, in order to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Cynthia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Evelinda

texts.en:
Evelinda is 58 years old, married and has three children.  

Evelinda is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Evelinda requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelinda has been farming rice for ten years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Lydia, a mother of four from Kapsowar, a remote village in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past two years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business, to make ends meet.

Lydia is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed one of them “Kipara,” meaning no feathers on the head.

Lydia wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Lydia will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Lydia is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Lydia dreams of a secure future for her children. Lydia awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine 31 years old. She is married with 3 children, aged between 3 and 8. Two of them go to school. She has been farming for 5 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for rice production. 

The profit from the business will be used for a machine which is used for processing rice.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Truth Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Truth and they are beginning their ninth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is composed of two members and is represented by Angela. The businesses that the members have are banku (cooked corn and cassava dough), fruit, snails and cassava.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Angela is one. She says that she joined ID-Ghana 4 years ago. She joined at the invitation of a friend from the institution, who came to visit her in her home. She now has a business selling banku (cooked corn and cassava dough). She lets it be known that she learned this business from her mother, and when she grew up, she decided to set up an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy corn and cassava dough, prepare banku and sell to customers. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family.

When she was asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy corn and cassava dough, prepare banku and sell it to customers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
For most people hitting the 60-year-mark means a life of absolute reliance on their children or immediate family members for their livelihood. However, for Jane, somehow life begins at 60. This mother of four has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years on her small parcel of land in the Kapsowar area of Kenya and has been earning a decent income. She also does some personal business to supplement her meager income. Of all the activities she is involved in, Jane enjoys poultry keeping the most. To her, poultry keeping went from being a way of life on an African homestead, to being a hobby, to being a business. 

Jane is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. With this loan, she seeks to grow her business. However, it has been a rough ride for her to find a financier who would front money to a mere smallholder farmer without substantial security or a bank statement showing a regular source of income. Today, Jane is a member of Cheptulon Self-Help Group. Through the group, she can access loans from Juhudi Kilimo, a micro-finance institution that was started to take care of small holder's financial needs. Since joining, the group has been trained to embrace saving money and group management to ensure cohesion and development.

Your loan will help Jane to earn more income that will enable her to pay for her children's education for a brighter future. The money will also enable her to take care of the basic needs of her family. When asked how she envisions life after successfully repaying the loan, Jane replied that her family's living standards will improve.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is forty-five years old, a single mother, and she has four children, one of whom attends school. She deals in produce mainly buying and selling rice, beans, and ground nuts. She hopes to expand her business through hard work and will use the loan to buy more rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Deena

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Deena works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines. Deena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF, in order to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Deena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
It is common to have a chicken farm in Kenya, but starting your own business is something else entirely. Nancy is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Kapsowar, a remote village in Kenya. She is a mother of three lovely children and has been practicing mixed farming for the last two years.

To earn a decent living, she sells eggs, milk, greens and engages in numerous small personal businesses, including transportation. Only recently, she started seeing how she could make more money through poultry farming. In the past, she saw raising hens as just a hobby. She wants to sell eggs, but assumes that the quantity she produces will not make economic sense. She needs to purchase more poultry. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand her business.

Nancy is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 from Kiva lenders, via Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase poultry. 

Future proceeds from the commercialization of her poultry farm are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident that her efforts will translate into a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu, aged 37 years, is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр занимается выращиванием овощей  более 10 лет. У него есть две большие теплицы для помидор и теплица для рассады. Александр  спокойный и трудолюбивый.  В этом году он планирует поставить новую теплицу. 
Александр просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 10 000 гривен на закупку удобрений и семян.   
За счет прибыли, которую Александр надеется получить с урожая, он планирует оплачивать учебу своей дочери в колледже.
texts.en:
Alexander has been growing vegetables for more than 10 years. He has two large greenhouses for tomatoes and a greenhouse for seedlings. Alexander is easygoing and hardworking. This year, he plans to install a new greenhouse.

Alexander is requesting a loan for 10,000 hryvnia (UAH) to buy fertilizer and seeds.

With the profits which Alexander hopes to receive from his harvest, he plans to pay for his daughter's college tuition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 45-year-old woman married to Benard who adds additional income to their family and are blessed with five children. Rosemary has been operating a retail shop for a period of nine years earning an income of 8,000 KES at the end of every month.

Rosemary was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of 10,000 KES and intends to use this amount to purchase sugar, tea leaves, wheat flour, maize flour, and detergents.

Rosemary plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to provide the best education to her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves, wheat, maize flour, rice and detergents to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба добрая женщина. Она замужем и мать 3 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и поэтому она сама справляется со всеми заботами. Матлуба более 10 лет занимается купле продажей сухофруктов. Она покупает оптом сухофрукты и реализует в розницу на местном рынке. Ее старший сын помогает ей введению бизнеса. Она всегда старается для благополучия своих детей. Матлуба должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, так как ее сын в этом поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Матлуба запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Matluba is a kind woman. She is married and a mother of 3 children. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation, and this is why she takes care of everything herself. Matluba has been involved in reselling dried fruit for over 10 years. She buys dried fruit wholesale and sells it retail at a local market. Her oldest son helps her with running the business. She always tries hard for her children's welfare. Matluba has to pay for her son's tuition because he got accepted to the Tajikistan State Commerce University this year. Matluba is requesting this loan to pay for the tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition

loans.name: Tayali

texts.en: Tayali is 32 years old, married, with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He sells domestic utensils and has been in that business for two years. He also practices farming for additional income. He began the business to develop himself. Tayali has a dream of constructing a commercial house on his new plot of land. As a hard-working man, Tayali is faced with the challenge of loss of goods and damages during transit to markets plus debtors. Tayali wants the loan facility to buy plates, glasses, cups, and many other items for him to sell.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, cups, and many others items to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jean works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a cafeteria business and raising ducks. 

Jean is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell for her general store business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. Jean hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 44 years old. He is married and has three children between the ages of 2 and 9, two of whom go to school. Theogene has been farming for 15 years. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for his rice. He will use the profits from his business to buy rice seeds.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for his rice.

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru: Зариф добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он родился в 1967 году. Зариф заботливый отец 3 детей. Его жена врач. Зариф работает в сфере коммунального хозяйства. Он работает более 23 года. Зариф всегда заботится об образовании своих детей. Его сын в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Зариф должен оплатить за учебу сына, но его зарплата не хватает для оплаты учебного договора. Поэтому он обратился в ИМОН за займом. Зариф мечтает, чтобы его сын стал высоко квалифицированным специалистом. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zarif is a kind and hardworking person. He was born in 1967. Zarif is an attentive father to three children. His wife is a doctor. Zarif works in the field of municipal services. He has worked in this field for more than 23 years. Zarif always worries about his children's education. This year, his son successfully graduated from secondary school and enrolled in university. Zarif needs to pay for his son's studies, but his salary is not enough to cover the tuition bill. This is why he turned to IMON for a loan. Zarif dreams that his son will become a highly-qualified specialist. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university tuition.

loans.name: Ma. Cecil

texts.en:
Ma. Cecil is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an agriculture business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Cecil successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Ma. Cecil's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Primitive

texts.en:
Primitive is 33 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 2 and 10, three of whom go school. Primitive has been farming for 12 years. With this loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for her rice. She will use the profits from her business to buy machines used for farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for her rice.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida 25 years old, married, and has one child. She has been farming for four years. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more rice fertilizers. Her profits will be used to build a new house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Mushtary

texts.ru: Муштари добрая женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дочь Томирис. Ей 7 лет. Сына зовут Тадрис и ему 4 года. Муштари сама воспитывает и обеспечивает своих детей. Муштари имеет высшее экономическое образование. Она работает в ИМОНе. В этом сентябре ее дочь пошла в первый класс. Ее дочь очень умная девочка. В школе она будет изучать английский, русский и немецкий языки. Муштари хочет, чтобы ее дочь получила хорошее образование и в будущем стать успешной и счастливой. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы дочери в школе. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mushtary is a kind woman. She is 26 years old. She is divorced and is raising two children. Her daughter's name is Tomiris. She is 7 years old. Her son's name is Tadris and he is 4 years old. Mushtary is raising and providing for her children by herself. Mushtary has a higher education in the field of economics. She works at IMON.  This September, her daughter will be in first grade. Her daughter is a very smart little girl. At school, she will study English, Russian and German languages. Mushtary wants her daughter to receive a good education so that in the future she will be successful and happy. She is requesting a loan for her daughter's primary school education. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's primary school education.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Socorro works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens.  Socorro is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of banana to sell to customers.

Socorro has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of banana to sell to customers.

loans.name: Grecia Dalila

texts.es:
Grecia de 24 años de edad, es licenciada en administración de empresas, esta acompañda su pareja trabaja de motorista, tiene un niño que aún no estudia, nadie mas vive con ella.

Grecia es empleada, en casa solamente tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa desde hace 3 años; lo aprendio de su madre, ademas tiene su sueldo como empleada, antes solo se dedicaba a estudiar. La distancia a su lugar de trabajo esta como a 2 km y viaja en bus, en la tienda que tiene en su casa le apoya un hermano.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para matricularse en la universidad, el préstamo le mejorara su calidad de vida, porque tiene la oportunidad de sacar su maestria, la necesidad satisfecha es la de seguir estudiando y con el préstamo tiene ayuda.

 Sus sueños son poder terminar de estudiar para tener la oportunidad de conseguir un empleo mejor y asi poder darle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Grecia is 24 years old, has a degree in business administration, and is married. Her husband works as a driver and they have a son who does not attend school yet. No one else lives with her. 

Grecia is employed and also has had a small shop out of her home for 3 years, which she learned how to manage from her mother. While before she was only studying, now she has a steady income. She travels the 2 km to work by bus, and her brother helps her run the store from her home. 

She is requesting a loan through CREDICAMPO to enroll in a masters program. The loan will improve her quality of life, because she has the opportunity to get her masters, and wants to continue with her education. 

Her dream is to finish her education so that she can get a better job, and be able to provide her child with a better future.

loans.use: to enroll in a masters program.

loans.name: Shealla Mae

texts.en:
Shealla Mae is 44 years old, married and has three children. 

Shealla Mae is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Shealla Mae requests a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Shealla Mae has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming.

In the future, Shealla Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bomson

texts.en:
Bomson is 52 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom attend school. He lives in Hoima, Uganda. He sells general merchandise, such as domestic utensils, sugar, salt, and soap. He earns additional income from farming.

Bomson is requesting a loan, which he will use to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to develop his business and educate children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Nelsin

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Nelsin works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal and rice retailing businesses. Nelsin is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Nelsin has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 34 years old and is married with 2 children aged between 4 and 6, both of whom go to school. She has been farming for 9 years. With the loan from Kiva she will buy more fertilizers for rice. She will use the profit from her business to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Àngel Mauricio

texts.es:
Ángel de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen 3  hijos y la mayor estudia kínder; él es el responsable de mantener a su familia y nadie más vive con ellos.

Desde pequeño se ha dedicado al trabajo de campo y aprendió de su padre. Actualmente siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz a unos 30 minutos de su hogar y se va caminando y su horario de trabajo es de siete a una 1 de la tarde, actualmente hace trabajos de albañilería en la comunidad.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar insumos agrícolas, compra de fertilizantes y veneno para que su cultivo sea resistente y vigoroso.

Espera que le vaya de lo mejor en el cultivo, generar buenas ganancias para cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar, poder invertir en la próxima cosecha y poder cancelar la deuda contraída sin problemas.
texts.en:
Ángel is 28 years old and studied until fourth grade.  He's accompanied by his partner who takes care of the house chores.  They have three kids; the oldest attends kindergarden.  He is responsible for maintaining his family and nobody else lives with them.  From a young age he has worked on the fields which he learned from his father.  He is currently planting 7,000 square meters of corn 30 minutes away from his house.  He walks to the plantation and his work schedule is from 7AM to 1PM.  He also works as a stonemason in his community.  
The loan he's requesting to CREDICAMPO is to buy agricultural materials, fertilizers, and poison to make his crop resistant and strong.  He hopes his crop is successful and that he generates a good profit to cover the basic needs of his home, invest for the next crop, and be able to pay the debt acquired  without problems.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials, fertilizers, and poison to make his crop resistant and strong.

loans.name: Santos Gabino

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 27 años de edad, estudio  hasta 5to grado , es acompañado y su esposa de dedica a los oficios domésticos, y a la elaboración de petates. Es padre de un hijo que aún no estudia por su edad, con él viven sus padres y dos de sus hermanos y su esposa


Santos se dedica a trabajar como jornalero en la agricultura,  pero también realiza trabajos de auxiliar de albañil, él aprendió este trabajo de uno de sus amigos que una vez lo busco a trabajar poco a poco fue aprendiendo y decidió seguir trabajando porque le es bien difícil encontrar otra fuente de ingresos para sostener su familia. Antes solo trabajaba como jornalero en la agricultura, el lugar donde salen a trabajar es variable, porque a veces se va con albañiles a zonas de gran distancia y viajan en bus.

  
 El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar insumos agrícolas para fertilizar y controlar la maleza de su milpa y frijolera, también cancelara la mano de obra que requiere para realizar las labores agrícolas. 

El crédito podrá satisfacer el deseo de sembrar una cantidad de tierra considerable, con el fin de obtener ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.


Los sueños de Santos, son que su hijo estudie hasta donde el decida, también quiere construir su casa.
texts.en:
Santos is 27 years old and has a 5th grade education.  He is married, and his wife works taking care of the household chores and also makes woven mats.  He is the father of a child who is not yet school-aged.  His parents live with him, as well as two of his siblings and his wife.

Santos works as a laborer in agriculture, but he also works as a masonry assistant.  He learned to do this work from one of his friends at a time when he was looking for work, and so he gradually learned this trade.  He decided to continue working because it is so difficult to find another source of income to support his family.  Before he used to work only as a laborer.  The place where goes to work varies because at times he goes with the bricklayers to areas quite far away and they travel by bus.  

Santos is requesting this loan from CREDICAMPO to buy agricultural supplies to fertilize and control the weeds in his corn and bean fields.  In addition, he will pay for the labor he needs to carry out his agricultural work.  With this loan, he will be able to satisfy his desire to cultivate a considerable amount of land, so that he can obtain the income he needs to improve his family's living conditions.

Santos dreams that his son will be able to study where he wants to, and he also dreams of building a house, even if only made of daub and wattle, so that he can live on his own with his wife and his son, because the family needs privacy.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fermented fish. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: José Secundino

texts.es:
José tiene 60 años de edad, no tiene ningún nivel de estudio pues los recursos económicos no le permitieron realizar sus estudios, está acompañado y tiene cinco hijos, ya cada uno vive aparte con su familia. 

José trabaja en la agricultura desde hace muchos años, y es la principal fuente de ingresos en su hogar, el oficio lo aprendió de su padre, además posee vaca de las cuales obtiene leche para su consumo. Para llegar a su trabajo agrícola debe hacer un recorrido de 30 minutos a pie.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar sulfato y más productos agroquímicos para su cultivo.

José desea seguir trabajando fuerte en la agricultura para generar ganancias y así también mejorar la vivienda para mayor seguridad de el y de su esposa.
texts.en:
José is 60 years old. He doesn't have any schooling because his financial resources did not allow him to do any studies. He is married and has five children. Each one lives on his own with his own family.

Jose has been working in agriculture for many years, and it is the main source of income for his household. He learned the trade from his father. He also has cows, from which he gets milk for his consumption. To get to his farming job, he has to travel 30 minutes on foot.

He needs the loan to purchase sulfate and more agrochemicals for his crops.

Jose wants to continue working strong in farming to generate revenue, as well as improve his home for more security for him and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase sulfate and more agrochemicals for his crops.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 47 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She sells clothes, which she has been doing for 18 years. 

Angelique requested a loan, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: José Ezequiel

texts.es:
José de 35 años de edad, es casado con buenos ideales.

El préstamo que esta solicitadno a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas. Para realizar los trabajos de la agricultura y darles una mejor asistencia a sus hijos y a su esposa y poder tener una vida mejor y es por eso que se acercó al Comité para solicitar su préstamo.
texts.en:
José, 35 years old, is married with good goals. 

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to purchase corn seed, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides, in order to carry out his agricultural work and better care for his children and wife and to be able to have a better life.  It is for this reason that he approached the communal bank to request his loan.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Mauro Adán

texts.es:
Mauro es un señor de 64 años de edad, es agricultor, por problemas de la economía que tenían sus padres, Mauro no pudo obtener un nivel de estudio. Esta casado y es padre de 9 hijos de 36, 34, 32, 30, 28, 26, 24, 22 y 11 años de edad, de los cuales solo uno esta estudiando, pero dependen de él 4, su esposa y tres hijos, los demás ya están casados y tienen su propio hogar. Mauro y su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, a la hortalizas y a la ganadería desde hace 45 años trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres, para llegar a su trabajo Mauro y dos hijos que le ayudan caminan un kilometro todos los días, el horario que desempeñan es de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución, es para la compra de 4 terneras para repasto, así aumentara la crianza de animales donde espera poder obtener mas ingresos en un futuro para darle a su grupo familiar una mejora calidad de vida.

Mauro sueña con tener animales de doble propicio lecheros y carne, también sueña con darle estudio a su hijo para que sea un profesional y persona de bien para un futuro.

La primera solo escribieron los 4 que dependen de él, pero en realidad son 9
texts.en:
Mauro is a 64-year-old man, and a farmer; due to financial problems that his parents had, Mauro was not able to finish school. He is married, and the father of 9 children, ages 36, 34, 32, 30, 28, 26, 24, 22, and 11, of whom only one is a student; however, he has four dependents, his wife and three children. The rest of them are now married and have their own households. Mauro and his wife work in agriculture, both vegetables and livestock, which he has done for 45 years since he learned it from his parents. To get to work, Mauro, with two of his children that help him, walk a kilometer every day, and their working hours are from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm.

The loan that he is requesting from the institution is to buy 4 pasture calves, and thus increase his animal breeding, through which he hopes to be able to obtain greater income in the future to give his family a better quality of life.

Mauro dreams of having two types of suitable animals, milk and meat, and also hopes to provide schooling for his son so that he may be a professional and a good person with a future.

Mauro's previous loan only stated that he had four children because only four of the nine are still dependent on him.

loans.use: to buy 4 pasture calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay a pending debt.

loans.name: Lelyn Arminda

texts.es:
Lelyn tiene 40 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado, es madre soltera y vive en casa de su madre con sus dos hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.


Desde hace 10 años, Lelyn se ha dedicado a la venta de hamburguesas, tacos, tortas y refrescos, su madre la incentivó a que realizara este trabajo ya que también se dedicaba a lo mismo, y lo iniciaron debido a la necesidad de obtener ingresos para mantener a su familia, el negocio lo tiene cerca de casa y trabaja de 5:00 AM a 5:00 PM. 

 
Este financiamiento lo necesita para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de  hamburguesas, tacos, tortas y refrescos, además quiere comprar un carretón  para vender papas fritas.

Su sueño es tener siempre su negocio y con el tiempo abrir un restaurante en un lugar mas cómodo y grande para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lelyn is 40 years old and studied as far as 6th grade. She is a single mother and lives in her mother's house with her two daughters, who are at primary school. 

For 10 years Lelyn has made a living selling hamburgers, tacos, cakes and drinks. Her mother encouraged her to go into this business since she did the same thing, and they started doing it because of the need to generate an income to support their family. Her business is located near to her home and she works from 5am to 5pm.

She needs this loan to buy ingredients for making hamburgers, tacos, cakes and drinks, and she also wants to buy a cart for selling chips.

Her dream is to always have her business and eventually to open a restaurant in a place which is bigger and more comfortable for her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making hamburgers, tacos, cakes and drinks and to buy a cart for selling chips.

loans.name: Jesús Alberto

texts.es:
Jesús de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado de educación básica, su compañera de vida trabaja en oficios domésticos, son padres de dos hijos de los cuales uno trabaja y el otro estudia nadie mas vive con él.

Jesús trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho por mas de ocho años y lo aprendio de su padre y decidio inculcarles a sus hijos el amor al trabajo. Ademas, se desempeña como albañil, antes él solo era agricultor, él mantiene el ganado como a dos cuadras y donde trabaja de albañil viaja a pie o en bus dependiendo de la distancia, tambien se involucra su señora y un hijo, su horario de albañil es de 7:30am a 4:00pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar ganado de repasto. Le mejorara su negocio porque tendra mas ganado y generara mayor ganancia y por lo tanto tendra mayor calidad de vida,la necesidad satisfecha es que podra comprar y podra obtener ganacias para pagar su crédito.

Sus sueños son poder trabajar mejor y tener la oportunidad de trabajar mas fuerte y darles el estudio a su hijo. El préstamo le ayudara mucho, porque tiene la oportunidad de comprar ganado sin necesidad de vender lo que ya tiene con las ganancias y con el sueldo de albañil.
texts.en:
Jesus is 43 years old, studied until fourth grade, and his life partner works in housekeeping. They are parents to two children, of which one works and the other studies, no one else lives with him. Jesus works with grazing livestock. He has done this for over eight years, learning from his father, and has decided to instil a strong work ethic in his children. He also works as a bricklayer, previously he only worked in agriculture. He keeps the livestock two blocks away and walks or catches a bus to where he works as a bricklayer, depending on the distance. His wife and one of his sons also get involved. His hours as a bricklayer are from 7.30am to 4.00pm.

The loan he is applying to CREDICAMPO for is to purchase grazing livestock. It will improve his business because he will have more livestock and will generate increased earnings, leading to a higher quality of life. The needs met will be that he will be able to purchase to then make a profit with which to repay his loan.

His dreams are to work better and have the opportunity to work harder and provide an education to his son. The loan will help very much, because it gives him the opportunity to buy livestock without the need to sell what he already owns with his profits and his wage as a bricklayer.

loans.use: to buy grazing livestock

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en:
Thacienne is 39 years old. She is married with four children, aged between 11 and 3 years old; two of them go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been running a business for the past fifteen years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy beans and vegetables for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and buy food for consumption.

loans.use: to buy beans and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is 40 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She sells clothes, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Violette requested a loan, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is aged thirty-seven and married with three children, all of them attending school. 

She operates a retail shop, and her dream is to keep growing her business through hard work. 

The loan will help her buy more sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old. He is married with three children aged between 10 and 5 years; all of them go to school. He has a shop and has been running a business for three years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Hellen Tonatsasei

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 48 year old Hellen from Harare. She is married with three children, two attending school. 

Hellen runs a retail business selling sugar, salt, bread, soap, cooking oil, rice, tea leaves and general groceries. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are liquidity and capital constraints. 

Hellen has requested a loan of $750 to purchase groceries for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to develop a commercial stand by building a supermarket. In the future, Hellen plans to open and operate a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for resale

loans.name: Luz Stella

texts.es:
Hace 13 años la señora Stella inicio de manera independiente el oficio de la agricultura pues desde que su esposo falleció tomo las riendas del hogar y no dejo caer el negocio por el contrario lo tiene hermoso, abundante, bien cuidado y productivo.
Es madre de 4 hijos de 19, 20, 21, 22 años de edad quienes tiene que agradecer a la vida pro toparse con una madre tan responsable que nunca se dejó quebrantar por la pérdida de su esposo y por el contrario los crió y los apoyo para que finalizaran sus estudios.

Trabaja de lunes a sábados 11 horas y el domingo lo dedica a la familia, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y quiere progresar pero ahora lo que la frena es el alto costo de los insumos agrícolas y la fuerte competencia pro precios que hay en el mercado. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos y riegos, para sus cultivos el monto es considerable por dos motivos uno es el alto costos de insumos agrícolas y dos que necesita tener una reservar para los cultivos que están pelechando.
texts.en:
Thirteen years ago, Stella started out as an independent farmer. Since her husband died, she took the reins of the home and she didn't let the business fail. On the contrary, it is beautiful, abundant, well cared for and productive. 

Stella is the mother of 4 children, ages 19, 20, 21, and 22, who are thankful for having such a responsible mother, who was never broken by the loss of her husband, and instead raised them and supported them so they could finish their schooling. 

She works from Monday to Saturday, 11 hours and she dedicates Sunday to the family. She is a very enterprising woman and she wants to get ahead, but the only thing stopping her now is the high cost of agricultural supplies and the strong competition for prices in the marketplace.  

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and sprinklers for her crops. The amount is considerable for two reasons: one is the high cost of agricultural supplies and the second is that she needs a reservoir for the crops that are wilting.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, fertilizers, sprinklers that she needs to care for her land and begin new crops in search of improved income so she can compete in the marketplace

loans.name: Osnaider

texts.es:
Al hablar de Osnaider se puede evidenciar que es un hombre muy trabajador y servicial que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y bienestar de la misma.

El vive en una humilde casa en el municipio de Valencia, Córdoba donde convive en unión libre con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años por los cuales ha luchado para darles una vida digna y una educación de calidad.

El se gana la vida con la compra y venta de pescado alrededor de este municipio y tiene plena fe en su negocio.

Es un individuo trabajador, constante y muy amante de su hijo.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar pescado al por mayor y así poder obtener capital para su negocio.

El tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario que apoyan este tipo de causas y ayudan al desarrollo de los campesinos.
texts.en:
Talking with Osnaider, he is a very hard-working and helpful man who does everything for the good of his family and for its well-being.

He lives in a humble house in the municipality of Valencia, Córdoba where his lives in a common-law marriage with his wife and his 3-year-old son, for whom he has fought to give a dignified life and a quality education.

He earns his living by purchasing and selling fish around this municipality and has full faith in his business.

He is a hard-working individual, who is constant and very loving with his son.

He asks for a loan to purchase fish in bulk and, in turn, to get capital for his business.

He is hopeful to be able to find help from people with caring hearts who support this kind of cause and help with the rural people's development.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk to capitalize his small business and be able to get his little 3-year-old son ahead.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 43 years old and married. She has six children between five and eighteen years old, and five of them go to school. She has been selling clothes for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy pairs of different clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school fees for her children and food consumption.

loans.use: To buy pairs of different clothes for sale.

loans.name: Felicite

texts.en: Felicite is 39 years old. She is married with only one child, aged 17, who goes to school. She sells clothes and has been selling for the past 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy different types of clothes like t-shirts, skirts, and dresses for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes like t-shirts, skirts, and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su conyuge y su menor hijo, dedicado a la comercialización de ganado vacuno asi como animales menores, la casa de Celestino se encuentra en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Celestino se dedico al comercio de ganado vacuno, hace 2 años. Él necesita el préstamo para invertir en negocio de comercio de ganado vacuno, comprando una cantidad mayor animales para asi poder surtir su stock de animales y poder cumplir con los diferentes gustos de su clientela.
texts.en:
Celestino is 42 years old and lives with his wife and youngest son. He earns his living selling cattle and other young animals. His home is in the district of Pucará, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in Peru's northern mountains.

Celestino has been selling cattle for two years. He needs a loan to buy more young animals and expand his herd so that he can meet the different requirements of his customers.

loans.use: Buy more cattle and expand his herd

loans.name: Violy

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Violy works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling salt business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and farming vegetables. Violy is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of salt to sell to customers.

Violy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of salt to sell.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en: Justin is 33 years old. He is married and has one child who is 7 months old and does not yet go to school. He has a shop and has been working in a business for the past eight years. With the loan, he would like to buy sugar, salt, biscuits, and books for resale. The profits from the business will be used to expand his business and for his family's welfare.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, biscuits and books

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 29 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 8 and 2 years old; two of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been working in a business for one year. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. Jeannette will use the profits from the business  to buy food and to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is her story:

Amelia is 43 years old, divorced and the mother of a ten-year-old boy. She lives in her parents' house and since her mother recently passed away she takes care of her father.

She makes a living by running a small convenience store which she has owned for 6 years now. She sells commercial products such as soda, chips, bread and dairy products. Amelia asks for this loan to stock up her store and be able to generate more income for herself and her son.

She works every day in order to be able to provide for her son and offer him a good future.

loans.use: to stock up her convenience store with commercial products.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира заботливая мать 3 детей. Ее старшие сыновья находятся в Российской Федерации. Ее дочь Садокат в этом году окончила среднюю школу и поступила в университет. Садокат умная девушка и учится отлично. В будущем она мечтает стать хорошем специалистом. Назира должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери, но ее зарплата не позволяет ей этого. Она работает более 15 лет в государственном учреждении. Ее муж тоже трудовой мигрант. Ее муж и сыновья не отправили денег для оплаты учебы Садоката, и поэтому она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nazira is an attentive mother of three children. Her older sons work abroad in the Russian Federation. Her daughter, Sadokat, graduated from secondary school this year and enrolled in university. Sadokat is a smart girl and does well in school. She dreams of becoming a great specialist in the future. Nazira needs to pay for her daughter's tuition but her salary does not allow her to do so. She has worked for more than 15 years in a government agency. Her husband, like her sons, is also a labor migrant. Her husband and sons did not send home money for Sadokat's tuition payment, which is why she is requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en: Federico is 58 years old and married with three children. After over seven years running a transportation service, he was able to put up a piggery business from his revenue and savings. His previous loan, used for motor repair, was successfully repaid. He had started his piggery business over two years ago and it is running well. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy feeding supplies in order to boost his pigs. In the future, he wants to improve and expand his business as well as improving the general living of the family.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita, a 45-year-old mother of five, has been operating her retail store and her own farm to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for these activities and was able to sustain her family's needs. She now needs farm fertilizer to restore the nutrients in her farm. She took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer. It is her desire improving her farm to ensure a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Menchie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grain business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Menchie is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grain to sell.

Menchie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grain to sell.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en:
A loan of 600 USD has been offered to Adelaide to improve her business. She is married and she has five children and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy items every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as candles, biscuits, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, body lotion, shampoo, soap, noodles and eggs. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Adelaide independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy candles, biscuits, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, body lotion, shampoo, soap, noodles and eggs.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario de 36 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela de la comunidad.

Mario se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, en la actualidad se ha convertido en una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos, de la misma forma también se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos los días viernes, y su hijo mayor le ayuda en el trabajo.

Mario necesita el crédito para comprar cerdos para criarlos ya que tiene maíz de la cosecha del año anterior y una parte de ese maíz se está preparando para ser procesado para convertirse en alimento para cerdos. 

Las proyecciones para un futuro son las de cumplir los sueños de sus hijos, que estudien hasta ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Mario, 36 years old, is married and has 2 children studying in the community school. 
Mario makes his living in agriculture, which he learned from his parents. It has now become one of his main sources of income. He is also involved in the buying and selling of pigs on Fridays; his older son helps him with this work. 
Mario needs a loan to buy pigs for breeding because he has corn from last year’s harvest , and he is processing part of that corn to become pig food. 
His dreams for the future are to fulfill the dreams of his children to study to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Walte Group

texts.es:
En un Recinto muy alejado de la Parroquia Lagarto – JESSICA  vive con sus padres luego de haber pasado una adolescencia muy difícil – debido a que sus padres de escasos recursos no le pudieron apoyar más en los estudios y es cuando JESSICA inicia a trabajar para poder financiar sus estudios secundarios. Empezó a trabajar en un salón de belleza gracias al apoyo de la dueña que con mucha paciencia le enseño el arte. Luego trabajo en un taller de costura donde también tuvo que aprender. Es de esta forma que ha podido continuar estudiando. En la actualidad JESSICA tiene un hijo y  sus padres le ayudan a cuidarla mientras ella trabaja en un local de ventas de productos agrícolas a 90 minutos de su casa.
Jessica tiene experiencia en cría de aves, le gusta mucho el campo y está motivada en invertir en cría de pollos por lo que comprará 200 pollitos y alimento balanceado para aves.
Sabe que es una buena inversión porque en poco tiempo podrá vender y volver a comprar pollos y al crecer poder dar trabajo a la gente del pueblo que goza de oportunidades de trabajo.
Agradece mucho a FODEMI por haber llegado hasta su comunidad, donde se cuenta con servicios de agua, teléfono ni carreteras donde puedan ingresar carros.
texts.en:
In a compound a long way from Lagarto parish lives Jessica with her parents. After a difficult adolescence because her parents couldn't afford to keep her in school, Jessica took a job to pay for her secondary school education. She started work in a beauty salon and with the help of the patient owner she learned new skills. Then she worked for a seamstress, again learning on the job. In this way she was able to continue her education.

Now Jessica has a son whom her parents help look after while she works selling agricultural products 90 minutes from her home. She has experience raising poultry and enjoys working in the countryside. This has motivated her to seek a loan to buy 200 chicks and specialized feed for them. She knows that this is a good investment as in a short time she will be able to sell the chickens, and then buy more chicks. As her business grows, she will be able to employ local people who will be happy for these employment opportunities.

Jessica is very grateful to FODEMI for having come to her community which has water and telephones but doesn't have roads for cars.

loans.use: Buy 200 chicks and special food for poultry

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru:
Муборак сельская женщина, проживающая в районе Шахритус. 15 лет назад она начала свою животноводческую деятельность и уже долгие годы успешно ведет этот бизнес. Мубораку в разведении  скотов помогают ее дети. Им по 19, 17 и 12 лет. Они учатся, а после занятий ведут скот на пастбища для выгула. Их отец находится на заработках в России, так как в районе он не нашел хорошей работы. 
Муборак хочет расширить свою деятельность. На сумму кредита она собирается приобрести пару молодых бычков и увеличить доходность бизнеса. Она надеется на этот кредит.
texts.en:
Muborak is a country woman who lives in the Shahrituz District. Fifteen years ago, she started her own livestock breeding business. She has been running this business successfully for many years already. Muborak's children help her raise her cattle. Her children are 19, 17, and 12 years old. The attend school and then after their lessons, they take the cattle out to the pastures to exercise them. Their father works abroad in Russia, as he could not find good work in their District.

Muborak wants to expand her business. With the money from the loan, she is planning to buy a pair of young bull calves to increase the profitability of her business. She relies on this loan.

loans.use: to buy a pair of bull calves to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio de 29 años de edad, es soltero y bachiller, esta estudiando en la universidad informatica. Vive con su mamá y solamente ella depende de él. 

Julio es propietario de un negocio de informatica desde hace tres años y es lo que él esta estudiando, lo hizo para tener un ingreso economico para sostener su propio estudio. Ademas, trabaja en un taller de carpinteria antes no tenia ningun negocio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar cables, tornillos, mouse, teclados, etc.  Le mejorara mucho porque tendra las herramientas necesarias para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes y asi tener mayor ingreso economico y por lo tanto mejorar la calidad de vida. 

Sus sueños son terminar su carrera universitaria y en cuanto a su negocio poderlo ampliar y lo lograra con una buena administración y con el apoyo  de Credicampo.
texts.en:
Julio, 29 years old, is single and a high school graduate; he is studying at the computer science university.  He lives with his mother, the only person depending on his support.  

Julio has owned a computer business for three years, and this is what he is studying.  He did this to have financial income to support his own education.  Besides this, he works in a carpentry workshop.   Previously, he didn't have his own business.

The loan he is asking for is to buy cables, connectors, mouse devices, keyboards, etc.  This will help Julio a lot because he will have the needed tools to provide good service to his customers and so have better financial returns and improve his quality of life.  His dreams are to finish his university degree and, as to his business, to be able to increase its size.  He will do this through good management and with the help of Credicampo.

loans.use: to buy cables, connectors, mouse devices and keyboards

loans.name: Secundino De Jesús

texts.es:
Secundino de 55 años de edad es divorciado y solo ha procreado un hijo que estudia en la escuela de la comunidad.

Él se dedica al trabajo de estructuras metálicas, actividad que aprendió gracias a un amigo. Los fines de semana se dedica a la agricultura y le da tiempo a su hijo para guiarlo por el buen camino. 

Él necesita el crédito para comprar materiales y herramientas necesarias en su taller ya que se le ha presentado un proyecto el cual requiere de una inversión, además comprará fertilizantes y otros insumos agrícolas pues es época de  invierno  aprovecha para cultivar la tierra.

Los planes de Secundino son inculcar buenos principios morales a su hijo, y realizar un nuevo préstamo para la ampliación del taller.
texts.en:
Secundino, age 55, is divorced.  He only has one child, and he goes to the community school.

Secundino works with metal structures.  He learned this business activity thanks to a friend.  On the week-ends he works in agriculture, and he gives his time to his son in order to guide him down a good path.

He needs the loan to buy materials and tools that he needs in his shop.  He has received a project, which requires an investment.  He will also buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies.  It is winter time, and he is taking advantage of the season to cultivate his land.

Secundino’s plans are to instill good moral values in his son and to get a new loan to expand his shop.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools needed for his shop and to buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Gulhinamo

texts.ru: Гулхинамо родилась в 1968 году. Она разведена и воспитывает 4 детей одна. Ее дети Музаффар, Султон, Кароматулло, Мухаммад. Кроме Музаффара все остальные дети не совершеннолетние. Гулхинамо 3 года назад начала свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и обеспечить своих детей. Гулхинамо в основном выращивает зерновые культуры. Ее дети помогают ей введению бизнеса. Гулхинамо постепенно год за годом развевает свой бизнес. Ее бизнес является основным источником семейного дохода. Она должна сделать осенний посев, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulhinamo was born in 1968. She is divorced and is raising four children on her own. Her children are Muzaffar, Sulton, Karomatullo, and Muhammad. Except for  Muzaffar, all the children are still minors. Three years ago, Gulhinamo began her own business cultivating agricultural crops in order to make a living and support her children. Gulhinamo mainly grows grains. Her children help her in conducting the business. Gulhinamo gradually year over year has been developing her business. Her business is the main source her family's income. She must do the autumn planting but does not have money. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental with her family. For over seven years, she has successfully managed her transportation service and was able to repay her previous loan used for vehicle repair. She has requested a new loan to buy a new set of tires for her motorcycle.

Elizabeth's future plan is to acquire an additional vehicle for her service. She wants her children to be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires for her motorcycle

loans.name: Araceli Del Socorro

texts.es:
Araceli es una mujer soltera de 50 años de edad que no tiene hijos por lo cual solo depende de sus facultades y de su negocio de venta de jugos naturales y comidas que compra a otro proveedor para poder pagar sus cuentas, como servicio públicos, arrendamientos, comida y transporte. 
 Al ser una persona sola tiene mucho sobrecargo de trabajo, trabaja sola y quiere comenzar a poyarse en alguien por eso quiere solicitar un crédito en la corporación que le permitirá comprar primeramente materia prima para realizar sus jugos, lulo, banano, naranja, mandarina, limón, mandarina, mango y comprar sus comidas para acompañarlos como pasteles, buñuelos, empanadas, panzerotis etc. 
Con le crédito podrá tener un buen material de trabajo producir más jugos tener existencias para cualquier exigencia del cliente. 
Sueña con poder tener una casa propia y seguirá por su camino trabajando para lograr su cometido, tener una pareja con quien compartir una vida y trabajar honestamente para lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Araceli is a 50-year old single woman who does not have children. This is why she depends only on her own abilities and her business selling natural juices and foods that she buys from another supplier, to be able to pay her bills, such as utilities, rents, food and transport.

Since she is alone, she is overloaded with work. She works alone and wants to start getting support. This is why she is applying for a loan with the corporation, which will allow her to buy ingredients for making her juices: lulo (Andean fruit), banana, orange, tangerine, lemon, and mango; and to buy foods to accompany them, like pies, fritters, empanadas, croquettes, etc.

With the loan, she will be able to have good working material to produce more juices to meet any customer demand.

She dreams of being able to have her own house and she will continue on her path, working to meet her commitment; and of having a partner with whom to share a life and work honestly to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy fruits to make her delicious juices:  blackberry, tangerine, mango, orange, lulo (Andean fruit), borojo (local fruit); and to buy food such as croquettes, empanadas, and pies.  She would like to have her own house.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 29 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 4 years and 4 months, not yet in school. She sells clothes and has been selling for the past 8 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more skirts, shorts, and trousers for sale. Angelique will use the profits from the business to reinvest in it and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more skirts, shorts, and trousers for sale.

loans.name: Generous

texts.en:
Generous is 36 years old and married with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Generous practices farming, growing crops such as tomatoes, mangoes, bananas and many others. She has been in farming since 2009 .She began  commercial farming to improve the standard of living and have food security for her family.  

Generous is a hard-working woman who desires to increase the acreage of her plantations despite price fluctuations and weather changes such as floods which hinder her business. She is accessing credit to purchase fertilizers and pay for labour.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labour.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
This is Claudine aged 43 years, she is married with 4 children aged between 2 and 12, and 3 of them go to school. She has been farming for 8 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is applying for a loan of $800 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy a refrigerator and stock to keep in her store such as  hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sagiko), milk, "body loosen", cigarettes, noodles, fish, shampoo and biscuits. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Celestina is living in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to shop,  including students.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sagiko), milk, "body loosen", cigarettes, noodles, fish, shampoo and biscuits

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 47 years old. She is married with two children, aged 25 and 17 years old; both of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been working in the business for the past fifteen years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 46 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 14 and 7 years old; all of them go to school. She has a mini market and she has been working in a business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as sugar, milk and bread for sale. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as sugar, milk and bread for sale.

loans.name: Amor Mia

texts.en: Amor Mia is separated from her husband. She has two children living with her in Ozamiz City. She has been running a transportation service for over two years to make a living. She also sells cosmetic products as her other source of income. She has been a  GDMPC member for a year and is recently taking a new loan to fully pay for her motorcycle used in the business. Her future plan is to acquire an additional vehicle to be used for expanding her transportation business.

loans.use: to fully pay for her motorcycle used in the business

loans.name: Whenuna

texts.en:
Whenuna is 53 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Whenuna has a dressmaking business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies and other equipment.

Whenuna has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies and other equipment.

loans.name: Berthe

texts.en:
Berthe is 30 years old. She is married with three children, aged between 6 years and 7 months; one of them goes to school. She sells clothes, and she has been running the business for the past three years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more women’s clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her business and welfare.

loans.use: to buy more women's clothes.
