loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María teresa una mujer dedicada a las ventas, es madre de 2 hijos de 21 y  8 años de edad y lleva el sustento para el hogar gracias a sus ventas por catálogo, es madre soltera cabeza de hogar con 48 años de edad, firme, muy determinante, cumplida y responsable en cada actividad de su vida y sobretodo muy correcta y honesta. 

Gracias a los microcréditos logro levantar su familia en total han sido 7 que ha solicitado con un excelente habito de pago y ahora pide otro para comprar mercancía y dejarla más económica  a sus clientes. 

Con el crédito comprara perfumes, productos de belleza, artículos como relojes etc. buscando surtir una pequeña tienda que está formando poco a poco.

Su sueño es continuar con su negocio seguir con sus hijos nunca se quiere separar de ellos, que estudien, y tenga un trabajo digno que sean unas personas responsables y grandes ejemplos de vida para otras personas.
texts.en:
María Teresa is a woman who devotes herself to sales.  She has two children, ages 21 and 8.  She supports her household thanks to her catalog sales.  She is a single mother, and she is the head of the household.  She is 48 years old, firm, determined, fulfilled, and responsible in every aspect of her life.  Above all, she is very proper and honest.

Thanks to the small loans, she managed to raise her family.  She has requested seven loans in all, and she has an excellent payment record.  She is now requesting another to buy merchandise and to make it more economical for her customers.

She will use the loan to buy perfume, beauty products, and items like watches, etc.  She is looking to stock a small store that she is, little by little, getting together.

Her dream is to continue with her business and to continue with her children as she never wants to separate from them.  Her dream is for  the children go to school, to have decent work, and to become responsible people and good examples in life for other people.

loans.use: to buy perfume, beauty products, and items like watches, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
9 años se tardó la señora Rosa para seguir los consejos de sus hermanas mayores quienes le enseñaron el oficio de la confección y ahora que abrió los ojos está dispuesta a montar su propio taller que traerá grandes beneficios como lo son generar mínimo  dos empleos, que este cerca de su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida. Hablamos de 9 años pues es lo que duro Rosa como operaria en diferentes empresas. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de máquinas plana, fileteadora y recubridora, agujas e hilos para iniciar su taller de confección a terceros. 
Rosa necesita mucho este negocio ya que tiene 4 hijos de 7, 12, 14, 17 años por quienes velar y esta será una gran oportunidad para mejorar y permitirse soñar con darles estudios a todos, soñar con seguir a sus hermanas y alcanzarlas como micro-empresarias y apoyar a familiares que necesitan el empleo para salir adelante
texts.en:
Rosa took 9 years to follow the advice of her older sisters, who taught her dressmaking. Now that she opened her eyes, she is willing to open her own workshop, which will provide great benefits, such as creating at least two jobs, allowing her to be near her house and improving her quality of life. We are talking of 9 years, as this is the time that Rosa spent as a worker in different factories. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a flat sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine, a covering machine, needles and thread to start her dressmaking workshop. 

Rosa needs this business, as she has four children (7, 12, 14 and 17 years old) whom she looks after. This would be a great opportunity to improve her life and allow herself to dream of giving them an education, following her sisters' path of becoming a small business owner, and supporting relatives that need employment to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, a covering machine and a flat sewing machine to start her own business and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en:
Marvie is a 36-year-old married woman with six children. She has five children who are currently in school.

Marvie is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 20 years. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Marvie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mustiola

texts.en:
Mustiola is a married woman with two children. Mustiola is 40 years old and has two children who are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mustiola has a general store business in the Philippines. Mustiola requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Mustiola has been in this business for 11 years. Mustiola would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ingris Yesenia

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Ingris es que ahora su hogar podrá tener unos ingresos extra.

Ella prepara y vende bebidas preparadas a base de productos de la marca Herbalife, que son productos para el cuidado personal y bienestar en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra de productos de Herbalife al por mayor y asi capitalizar su negocio.

Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus bebidas siempre disponibles para sus clientes ya que estos visitan su local con el ánimo de consumir una bebida saludable y rica.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to the courage and perseverance of Ingris her household now has an extra income. She prepares and sells drinks in the municipality of Medellin that have a base of Herbalife products which are products for personal care and well being. She started this business with the urge to find new income to support her family. Her husband and children are her main motivation to work each day and try to improve every day.

She hopes to boost her business with the purchase of these Herbalife products wholesale and put capital into her business. With these supplies she can have her drinks always available for her clients as they visit her stall with the desire to have a tasty and healthy drink. Her biggest dream is to have a restaurant in the same area so as not to lose her clientele.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products to prepare drinks and sell them to the public.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Michelle is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Michelle has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from furniture making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a repeat customer and a resident of Rukoni, Ntungamo district. His major activity is farming, especially growing cabbages. He has applied for loan of UGX 3,000,000. He wants to use the money to buy fertilizers to improve his yields. He has been having a challenge of low productivity within his farming production due to poor farming methods. He wants to mulch and buy insecticides so that he can get good quality output. His prime target is to yield high output from his plantations and also to take his children to better schools. But he is limited by capital and funds to enable him to achieve his dreams. With this loan he believes his production will improve and this lifestyle will change in the society. Thank you Kiva lenders for the financial support.

Pictured is Francis with the Ugafode credit officer (right to left).

loans.use: to buy mulch and insecticides.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is an old client of the institution and married with two children who are still young. He operates a motorcycle transport (boda boda), which he has done for a period of six years and it is his major source of income. He took the first loan and he bought his own motorcycle because before he was riding someone else's motorcycle. Joseph applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy building materials such as iron sheets, cement, sand, timbers, and iron bars to complete building his first house. Joseph thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance extended to him, which has enabled him to accumulate assets and he hopes to get continued financial assistance from Ugafode until he stabilizes.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets, cement and sand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand to make blocks. Her micro-business pays for her accounting and finance studies.

loans.name: Carlos Efraín

texts.es:
Carlos 47 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos, es muy conocido en su comunidad por ser alguien honesto y trabajador que siempre busca cumplir sus objetivos.  


Carlos se dedica a la albañilería y a las instalaciones eléctricas en casas, ya tiene bastante tiempo realizando esta actividad por la cual es muy conocido y las personas lo buscan bastante para que les realice este servicio.


Él necesita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa en la cual  vive con su familia.


Sus planes a futuro son tener una casa muy bonita ya que siempre ha sido su sueño.
texts.en:
Carlos is 47 years old and has a partner and three children. He is well known in his community for being an honest and hardworking man who always looks to achieve his goals.

Carlos works as a construction worker and also makes electric installations in people's homes. He has had this occupation for quite some time and is well known in his community, so people hire his services frequently. 

He needs this loan to buy construction materials to improve the home where he lives with his family. 

His future plan is to have a beautiful house, as this has always been his dream.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve the home where he lives with his family.

loans.name: Vanessa Claire

texts.en:
Vanessa Claire has been providing food in her cafeteria while her husband works overseas. She earns better income from this to support the needs of her children. She was encouraged to improve her cafeteria, since she earns better income from this. 

Her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. She started accepting catering services and this is doing well. She is taking this new loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is 26 years old and has a live-in partner with one child. With her child currently in school, Rhea works very hard to provide for them. Rhea runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rhea has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, eggs, biscuits, candies, etc. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Rhea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 37-year-old married man with three children, attending different schools.  He is a farmer who grows sweet bananas for sale and uses the surplus for home consumption. He also buys and sells agricultural products. He works four days a week and eleven hours each day and is motivated by the fact that it is his profession and it requires less capital.

He buys and sells agricultural produce in the form of dry beans, corn and coffee; a business from which he gains income that he uses to support his family.  He hopes to use the loan to buy corn and coffee so that he can increase the size of his business.  He sells his products to local people around the trading center and surrounding areas.  His hopes and dreams are to expand his business.  

He is described as a shrewd businessman and he appreciates the services offered by Ugafode micro finance limited.

loans.use: to buy coffee and corn to sell to his clients.

loans.name: John Edward

texts.en:
John is a 45-year-old Ugandan male married to Kezekiya. They have four children, and all of them are in school. They live in a trading center.

John is a produce dealer and sells crops like maize, beans, and ground nuts. He also does some farming himself, although on a small scale.

He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited to buy agricultural produce since it is the right season now. He has promised to pay back the loan in one year because he will have made sales.

His plans for the future are to educate all of his children and to acquire more land for agriculture. He describes himself as an achiever and hardworking person.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to sell

loans.name: Kabuga Tweyombekye Group

texts.en:
Teopista is a female Ugandan, 46 years old and married with 7 children who are 17, 16, 15, 12, 10, 5 and 2 years old. Three of her children attend school and she is responsible for paying all their tuition.

Her main business is the sale of agricultural produce. She also engages in farming on a small scale 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 800,000 to buy corn for the produce business. She expects to pay after making some profits. Her dream is to educate all her children. She describes herself as a hardworking and honest person. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their continuous support.

loans.use: To buy corn to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Enos

texts.en:
Enos is a 34 year old Ugandan. He is married with two children aged three and seven with one attending school. They are residents of a rural garden and are mainly agriculturalists. His main source of income is the sale of locally processed brew from banana juice. He also carries out small scale farming to supplement his meager income so that he can adequately provide for his family. He has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy locally processed brew because it is affordable for the rural population, he will therefore get profits.
He is however challenged by limited capital to invest in his business and also the high prices of the bananas. His plans for the future is to construct a house for his family. He is hardworking and social.

loans.use: to buy locally processed brew to sell

loans.name: Matiya

texts.en:
Matiya is a married man with five children of which three are in school while others are still young. He operates a retail shop in a small trading centre near his home in Kiruhura district with limited capital. His retail shop is his main source of income where he gets income to support his family and pay school fees for his children. Matiya sells his products to the nearby village centers and villagers. 
However his main challenges are stiff competition, price fluctuations and lack of enough capital to buy more items needed by his customers. He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 to help him buy more stock of sugar, rice, washing powder, dry cells, flour, beverages for his business and use a small portion of the money to pay tuition for his children. 
His dream is to build a permanent house for his children and also take them to good schools.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar, rice, flour and other items

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon, a married man in rural Lyantonde, has been rearing cows since his childhood. It’s from this that he picked an interest in fattening cows as a business, since he knew their dos and don’ts. This business has helped him to get income to meet his family’s needs, such as food, education and health needs for his children. 

He needs the money to buy more cows that he will fatten and later sell at a profit. He is hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and later sell

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is married and is a resident on the outskirts of Mbarara, Uganda. Abel has rented all his life and has felt a heavy burden of the rental costs and the high cost of living because of his large family. He is hardworking.

Abel started building a residential house so that he can cut his living costs. He now needs a loan to buy cement, iron sheet and sand so that he can complete his house. 

Abel is grateful that UGAFODE was willing to come to his rescue when he needed money. He hopes that with a complete house, his children will live decently and his costs will go down.

loans.use: To buy cement, iron sheets and sand to finish building his house.

loans.name: Piason

texts.en:
Paison lives in Kitunzi with his family. He also looks after his mother.
He operates a mobile money business. He faces a lot of competition from his neighbors. He hopes to use this loan to purchase mobile money float from the mobile network provider so that he is able to serve his clients. Thank you Kiva lenders.
Pictured is Paison with the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: to purchase mobile money to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Edrine

texts.en:
Adrine is a 26-year-old single mother of two children. She comes from Nyarukika, in the rural Ibanda district. Both of her children are in school. She runs a retail shop with a capital of UGX 700,000.

Adrine has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000  to help her add more stock to her retail business and pay school fees for her children. Her major challenge is limited capital to add into her business.

Adrine is a very honest and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy soda, sugar, flour, soap and beer to sell

loans.name: Obama 3 Group

texts.en: Alex, a resident of Makindye, a city suburb, is 33 years old and a member of the Obama 3 Group. He is married with one child. Alex has been in the business of selling electronics for the last 10 years. He was working in an electronics shop where he saved some money and in 2004, he began his own business selling electronics (both secondhand and new) out of the experience he had gained and is now doing well.  He approached UGAFODE for a third loan through the group to add to his stock of electronics for his business. The customers and neighbors describe Alex as hardworking, honest and focused.

loans.use: To buy  electronics for sale

loans.name: Meeme

texts.en:
Meeme lives in Rubaga, a city suburb, with her family. She has two children who are both in school. 

She operates a retail shop that sells daily household use items. She faces a lot of competition from her neighbors, because she  does not have a variety of goods.

She hopes to add a stock of sugar, soap, wheat and corn flour for her business in case she is given a loan, and this will help to beat the competition and increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy daily household use items to sell in her retail shop

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roberto es un hombre de 66 años de edad, padre de 4 hijos ya todos ellos mayores de edad, fue agricultor toda su vida tenía sus terrenos y sus animales hasta que llego el trágico día en que por motivos de violencia tuvo que abandonar su hogar para salvar su vida. 
Se mudó a Sincelejo donde encontró en la venta ambulante de limones (ver foto) una manera de llevar algún sustento para su hogar pero Roberto quiere recuperar todo lo que perdió, quiere reiniciar su vida y ser lo que aprendió hacer un campesino.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de verduras y frutas para vender ambulantemente, también quiere comprar gallinas y huevos para comercializar está buscando retornar a lo que un día fue y esto realmente lo hace feliz por lo que necesita tu ayuda pues meceré una oportunidad de recuperar con trabajo y honestidad lo que un día la violencia le quitó
texts.en:
Roberto is 66 years old and the father of four grown children. He was a farmer his whole life, and he had his land and his animals until violence took it all away one tragic day when he had to abandon his home to save his life.

He moved to Sincelejo where he found work selling limes (see photo) from a cart as a way of providing some support for his household. But Roberto wants to recover all that he lost and start his life over doing what he learned as a farmer.

He is asking for a loan to buy vegetables and fruit to sell from his cart.  He also wants to buy chickens and eggs to sell. He is hoping to return to what he had before and this makes him very happy. He needs your help to do this because he deserves a chance through hard work and honesty to recover what violence robbed him of one day.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell from a cart; he will also buy chickens and eggs so he can recover what he has lost to violence.

loans.name: Abudu

texts.en:
Abudu is 39 years old, a resident of the city outskirts and  married with four children. He also takes care of two other children who are orphans by providing them with basic needs since they lost their parents. 

Abudu drives a taxi to earn a living. He started this job in 2004 after failing to find formal employment and yet he had to meet the growing needs of his family. Abudu mainly deals in town service transportation.

Abudu’s dream was to own a taxi  which he did using the previous loans and is now happy that his income has increased. He now needs money to compete payment on  a plot of land so that he can build for his family and cut on the cost of renting. He is hard working and honest and thanks the kiva lenders for the job well done.

loans.use: to buy  land

loans.name: Zeldah

texts.en:
Zeldah is a repeat client, aged 59 years old and a resident of Kinyobwa Nyanga. She is married and looks after eight children. She applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX for improving her banana plantations through adding more cow dung and to hire labor to clear and prune the banana plantation so that she can increase her yields.

Her source of income is selling matooke from the banana plantation so she decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to work on her plantation so as to increase her income such that she can pay school fees for her children. Then they can study well without interference.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and hire labor to clear and prune the banana plantation.

loans.name: Nastorio

texts.en: Nastorio is an 32-year-old client. He is married with 3 children aged 2, 9, and 1 and a half years, and two of them attend school. He grows tea, a job which he started in the year 2003.  He has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizer and tea for trading. He started the business so he could have a clear source of income. He grows tea for 8 hours a day and 5 days a week in his rural area of Kyamuhunga, Igara, Bushenyi District. His clients are tea traders and tea factories. He is a very hardworking man, which has helped him greatly to thrive in the market despite the poor weather of the dry season. He hopes to educate all his children for a better future. Right now, he hopes to get high yields after buying fertilizer and tea for trading using the loan money in this season.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and tea.

loans.name: Phionah

texts.en: Phionah is a new customer, aged 28-years-old, and married with 2 children.  She does cattle fattening to get income to sustain her family. She buys and sells cows after she has fed them and they have fattened, this helps her to increase her income. She has done this for three years and with the experience, she hopes she will utilize the loan well to increase her income. She has been challenged with limited capital, but this will soon be history once she gets the loan funds. She is hard working.

loans.use: To buy cattle to fatten and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ishaka Women Development Group

texts.en: Mrs. Peninah is an old client and a member of Ishaka Women's Development Group. She is aged 46 years and a single mother of one child.  She has a salon business and her clients are women. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX to add to  the working capital for her business in form of relaxers, hair gels, hair extensions among other items.  She started her business in the year 2012 for her own development and to look after her child.  She is a hardworking and focused lady who works 12 hours a day. Her business is carried out in Ishaka Division, Bushenyi district. She is faced with the challenge of debtors as most of her customers dont pay on time, power cut-offs, and lack of enough water. However, through her hard work, she has managed her business and is determined to grow it massively. She would like to tell UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI) that it should continue supporting low income earners. She hopes to buy land and build her own house in the near future.

loans.use: To buy daily-use household items to sell in a retail shop

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: During the over eight years she has been running the business, Merly has earned well to improve her family's quality of living. Her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. She always finds ways to augment their situation as well as to increase her sales. She had to add inventory capital to gain more income in return. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional varieties of grocery goods to resell. She rests assured of having more income from this investment and wants to improve the general living standard of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es:
Bibiana, de 21 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros en distintos almacenes del municipio de Itagüí.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa al por mayor y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presentan en uno de setos almacenes para ser independiente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Bibiana, who is 21 years old, is sure of what she wants in life and has resolved to complete her studies in order to succeed and have a good life.

She works selling a variety of merchandise in several stores in the city of Itagüí, such as clothing, accessories like wallets, and some cosmetics, among other things.

She wanted to start because she wants to earn the resources she needs to support herself and her studies, and to contribute to her family's household expenses. She is an enterprising and very disciplined woman.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a wide variety of clothing wholesale, which will allow her to take advantage of the opportunity to be independent that they have offered her in one of the stores where she sells items.

She hopes to progress as a businesswoman and have a more stable income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of clothes wholesale to start her independent business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 47 years of age and is an old client of UGAFODE-Ishaka branch, having taken one loan. He is married with six children. Only two of them are still in school at the moment. 

He does farming as his main source of income, and his major clients are coffee traders. He is also a teacher earning a monthly salary to supplement his monthly income. He started farming in the year 2006, working eight hours a day and six days in the week. The farm is located in Ishaka, Bushenyi District, which is a good place for his farms, where he has a ready market. 

He started farming to have a source of income and has seen it grow from one level to another since 2006. He hopes to buy fertilizer for his farms so that he produces high quality products, hence fetching him more profits. The main challenge that he faces in the business is competition from other farmers of the same category, but he is ready to beat it after getting a loan to buy fertilizer and producing high quality products through his hard work.

He is requesting for a loan of 1,500,000 shillings to buy fertilizer for his farm. He hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Benric Cbd Foundation Group

texts.en:
Jackson is a 29-year-old male Ugandan; he is married, with four children age 6, 4, 3 and 1. Two attend school.

Jackson is an agricultural produce trader, and he sells crops like beans and maize. He has applied for a loan from Ugafode to add to his business by buying stock of dry beans and corn that he will stock and sell to schools especially this being a back to school season, his clients will buy the products. He is optimistic he will make enough sales. 

His plan for the future is to acquire a motorcycle to assist him in transportation of his produce. 

His major challenges include limited capital, but he describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy stock of  corn and beans to sell to local schools.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 40 years old and married with four children aged 19, 15, 12, and 7. Three of them attend school.
His major business is the sale of locally-made gin, but he also deals in sales of produce and also farming. He resides in a trading center.
He has approached UGAFODE for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to restock the gin and attract more customers.He sells the gin at his pub. He will also buy corn using the loan money. His plans for the future is to acquire more land and expand his business. He however faces challenges of price fluctuations for his products and some business people who sell poor-quality products.
He describes himself as an honest, hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy local gin to sell at his pub.

loans.name: Eriazari

texts.en:
Eriazari is a 38-year-old married man with 7 children attending different schools. He has a coffee business in a trading centre, and he works 6 days a week and 7 hours a day.

He is also an agriculturalist who grows maize, beans, and coffee, from which he gets an additional income to support his family; he has been in this business since 2005.

Eriazari hopes to use the loan to purchase more coffee for his business. He usually sells his goods to fellow traders.

However, he faces a challenge of poor weather conditions like heavy rains and price fluctuations, which affect the business. 

He is described as an honest and hardworking man.  He appreciates lenders for the services offered.

loans.use: To buy coffee to trade

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul aged 32 years is single but looks after his siblings. He is involved in cattle fattening and trade - a project that he has been doing since his early years. According to him, through the above business he has been able to provide everything for his family.

Alongside cattle fattening and trade, Paul is involved in is school business which also contributes to his income. According to him through the above projects he has been able to go for further studies.

Paul is acquiring this facility to boost his cattle fattening business and farming. He says he is going to buy cows. Paul says his customers are basically cattle traders from his home area. According to him, his biggest challenge is cattle diseases such as foot and mouth disease and lack of enough capital to run his cattle trade business.

He is described as a hard working man who has been able to achieve everything from his strength. Finally he appreciates work done by UGAFODE through enabling him with credit.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a businessman dealing in general merchandise, aged 42 years. He is married and a longstanding client who has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to be able to buy general merchandise and tea leaves. He started the retail stock business in a rural setting but has seen it grow from one level to another through his hard work.

The business is carried out in Kyamuhunga, Igara Bushenyi District. His customers are the tea traders, and their continued support and his tireless effort have helped his business to grow. He started this very business to be able to have a source of income and in the long run to meet his family's needs adequately. Five of his children attend school at the moment. His major challenge in the business is competition, but he is ready to grow it through his hard work. He hopes to educate all of his children for a better future.

loans.use: to buy retail stock for his general store.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en: Nathan does tea growing as his sole source of income. He started the business in 2004 with the aim of getting income to support him. He works 8 hours a day and 5 days in the week. The business is located in Nyakazinga, Igara, Bushenyi District which is a good place for his business since there is a big market. He started tea growing to have a source of income and he has seen the business grow from one level to another. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy fertilizers for his tea farming. His major clients are tea traders. He hopes to be financially stable in future. He is faced with the challenge of poor weather of dry season which severely affect his yields.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for his tea plants

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a new client to UGAFODE. He is taking out a loan of UGX 1,500,000. The 38-year-old man is married and blessed with five children, with three attending school. He carries out a second-hand clothes business in a close trading center to fend for his family. His main challenges have been limited capital and competition. He has a dream of expanding his business to greater heights. 

With this loan from UGAFODE, Julius is hopeful that his business will expand and improve the sales since he will be able to compete favorably in the market with enough capital, using the loan he got from UGAFODE. Julius appreciates Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial assistance rendered to him.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Milagros Del Rocio

texts.es:
Milagros del Rocío tiene 34 años, es conviviente, es muy conocida en el medio por la labor de crianza y venta de animales menores. Vive en casa familiar, con hija de 11 años quien estudia en colegio nacional de Saña, conyuge trabaja en Lima. Milagros del Rocío es una persona con buenas referencias laborales, y personales por parte de sus vecinos; vive en una comunidad habitada por gente respetuosa, que se dedicadan al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Milagros del Rocío se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, cerdos, pavos etc, desde hace más de 03 años aproximadamente, ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de cerdos y alimentos para estos, lo que le va a permitir criar a sus animales en mejores condiciones, y a la hora de llevarlos al mercado los podrá ofrecer a un mejor precio, lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida mejorará.
texts.en:
Milagros del Rocio is 34 years old, is married, and is very well-known in the area for her work raising and selling small animals. She lives in her family home with her 11-year-old daughter who is studying in national college in Saña. Her spouse lives in Lima. Milagros del Rocio is a person with good professional and personal references from her neighbors. She lives in a community with respectful people, who work in shops, agriculture, and livestock. She lives in the Saña district, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.

Milagros del Rocio raises and sells small animals, including ducks, pigs, turkeys, etc. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of pigs and food for them, which will allow her to raise her animals in better conditions, so that she can sell them for a better price in the market. This will help her earn a better income and earnings, and will help improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food for them, so that she can raise the animals in better conditions.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo, a 57-year-old father of four, lives in Clarin with his family. His wife works as a government employee, and he operates their transportation services business as a side venture from farming. He earns daily income from these services that covers their daily expenditures.

Eduardo's children are still studying and he is now borrowing a new loan from GDMPC microfinance to pay his children's school tuition fees. Having planned to buy tires for his motorcycle, he used a portion of this loan to buy the same. In the future, he wants to see his children in prosperous careers.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his vehicle and to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is married with two children. For the past ten years she has raised pigs to sell; her husband is an employee of the Philippine government. Together they are able to cover their living expenses.

Annabelle recently took out a 10,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy feed for her pigs. Her hope is to improve her business so she can increase her profits and raise the family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion, 36 years old, is married and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Salvacion has been raising pigs for four years and has previously borrowed eight times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies that arrive every day at his work, and to purchase a house for his mother and family

loans.name: Kisakye Group

texts.en: Agnes, aged 22, is a member of the Kisakye group in Nabbingo. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are going to school. Agnes dropped out of school at an early age of 16, she got married. Her husband, being a businessman encouraged her to begin a business. Thus, in 2012 she began a business of selling charcoal,because charcoal is a major source of cooking fuel for the low income urban dwellers and therefore was assured of customers. Much as the capital was little she believes she could get some profits to supplement the earnings of her husband so as to look after their family. Through getting loans from UGAFODE her business has improved and she is doing well. Agnes approached UGAFODE for a second loan through the group so as to buy more stock of charcoal for sell. This will increase her income. She thanks UGAFODE for giving them this financial boost. She is very hardworking, trustworthy, and focused.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia desde hace 8 años se dedica a la producción agrícola y diariamente se levanta para trabajar y atender sus tierras en las cuales tiene un cultivo de flores.

Es una actividad aprendida de manera empírica y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas y habilidades en este campo.

Adicionalmente genera ingresos alternos gracias a sus conocimientos en elaboración de aceites y cremas naturales.

Hoy en día se siente orgullosa de lo que ha podido construir con su esfuerzo y se siente muy agradecida con la vida por las oportunidades que le brinda de progresar y salir adelante.

Ella pide un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, riegos,  pesticidas y semillas, de este modo mantener sus tierras en optimas condiciones para los cultivos.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y allí poder disfrutar de su vejez al lado de su esposo y sus hijos.
texts.en:
For eight years Silvia has worked in agricultural production, and she gets up every day to work and tend to her land, on which she has a crop of flowers.

It is a business she learned empirically, and little by little she has been perfecting her techniques and abilities in this area.

In addition, she generates other income thanks to her knowledge of preparing natural oils and creams.

Now she feels proud of what she has been able to build with her effort, and she feels very grateful for life for the opportunities that it offers her to progress and get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of compost, irrigation, pesticides, and seeds and in this way to maintain her lands in optimal conditions for her crops.

Her great dream is to have a house of her own and there to be able to enjoy her old age at the side of her husband and their children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and flower seeds to apply them on her land and be able to generate some much healthier crops

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a married man doing farming. He is a repeat client whose previous loan paid off since he  was able to increase his profits from the usual ugx,500,000 in  a season to a whooping 800,000. He is grateful to the kiva lenders. He does the farming in a rural area of Rugabagaba Ruhinda, Mitooma District. He started farming with the aim of having a steady source of income to have school fees for his children. He works 8 hours a day and 6 days a week and his clients are all categories of people that have helped him to grow from one level to another. His major challenge is competition from other farmers but is determined to shrive in the market through his hard work. He has applied for a loan of shs 5,000,000 to buy mulches, manure and cows for farming. He hopes to educate all his children in future.

loans.use: to buy mulch and organic manure for farming.

loans.name: Rwemengo Tumanyane Group

texts.en:
The Rwemengo Group is located in Rwemengo town. It is comprised of men and women who are involved in small-scale trade and simple agriculture.

Joyce is a 50-year-old single mother with three children. One of her children is in school. Joyce runs a small retail shop with limited capital where she earns income to provide her basic needs. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX through the group to help her add more stock of retail items such as sweets, bread, salt, sugar among other items in her business. She will use a small portion of the money to pay tuition for her children

Joyce thanks UGAFODE for lending to her group even when they did not have collateral and she thanks Kiva lenders for the partnership. She is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, bread, and sweets among other items to sell in her retail store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 51 years old and blessed with four children. She is a responsible housewife who, with her husband, works to support her family by buying and selling rice within their community.

Vilma’s youngest son is studying to get a Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering at Nueva Vizcaya State University. Due to the high cost of tuition, however, she is not able to pay all of the tuition and miscellaneous fees for her son.

For this reason Vilma is applying for a 10,000 PHP educational assistance loan through ASKI to fully pay these costs. She looks forward to seeing her son graduate and become a successful engineer.

loans.use: to pay tuition and miscellaneous fees for her son.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva, 33 years old, is married and has five children, four of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  For the past three years, Eva has operated a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell. In the future, Eva would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en: Norberta is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 10 years, she has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. Norberta has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers. Norberta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is married and works hard to support her family. For the past eight years she has sold dried fish to earn an income.

Rufa has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell. She is working and saving to better her business bit by bit.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Marie Yolande

texts.en: At a young age, Marie Yolande started as a small street vendor. In 1990, Marie Yolande and her husband moved to Petionville where she opened a grocery store. People have to go far to buy their groceries. They have to pay transportation fees for longer distances. As an entrepreneur, she rapidly decided to take advantage of all the business opportunities in the community. With the previous Zafen loan, the business was able to buy a freezer and a generator. Now, Marie Yolande wants to increase her processed food products for more sales. A second loan will be crucial for the business' financial performance.

loans.use: To buy processed food products for increased sales

loans.name: Mercedes Donatila

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación básica, no continuó pues sus padres creían que era una pérdida de tiempo, está casada y vive con su esposo y su único hijo el cual estudia en la escuela.


Mercedes se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, tales como crema, queso y cuajada, ya tiene más de seis años en este negocio y lo aprendió por su madre cuando estaba pequeña, ella sale a vender de casa en casa 3 veces a la semana.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más mercadería, comprará crema, queso, cuajada para vender ya que tiene más demanda de clientes. 

Ella sueña con seguir adelante en el negocio, que su hijo culmine sus estudios de educación básica y luego siga en la universidad, además le gustaría tener dos hijos más con su esposo.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 26 years old and studied only up to the third grade because her parents thought it was a waste of time.  She is married and lives with her husband and their only child, who attends school. Mercedes sells dairy products such as cream, cheese, and junket.  She has been doing this for more than six years and learned how from her mother since she was a little girl. Mercedes sells house-to-house three days per week.

She needs a loan to buy more merchandise to sell since demand from her customers is increasing. She will buy cream, cheese, and junket. She dreams of continuing her business and that her son will finish his basic education and then go on to university.  She would also like to have two more children with her husband.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as cream, cheese, and junket because demand from her customers has increased.

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer de 32 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, actualmente está casado y tiene dos hijos que ya estudian.


Elmer junto a su esposa poseen un comedor desde hace 6 meses, anteriormente él se dedicaba a la albañilería y de repente su esposa tuvo la idea de poner el negocio de venta de comida, el decidió apoyarla y es así como siguen en pie con dicho negocio.   



Él necesita el crédito para comprar un mostrador de comida y dos mesas para el negocio, de esta forma se solventan la falta de capital que Elmer tenía para invertir en su negocio.

Sus planes son seguir invirtiendo en el negocio para incrementar sus ingresos y que su familia viva bien.
texts.en:
Elmer, who is 32 years old, went to school through the sixth grade of basic education. He is now married and has two children who are in school.

Elmer, along with his wife, has had a restaurant for six months. Before that, he worked as a mason, and suddenly his wife had the idea of setting up a business of selling food. He decided to help her, and this is how they remain in this business.

He needs the loan to buy a food counter and two tables for the business. In this way they can overcome Elmer's lack of capital to invest in his business.

His plans are to continue investing in the business to increase his income and to have his family live well.

loans.use: to buy a counter and two tables for his business.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana started her business in 2005 after some experience at a sister’s company. She thinks she was lucky in launching her own economic activity with a small amount of cash. As time went by, Christiana rented a location, enhanced the business, traveled to the Dominican Republic to purchase supplies. She sells food warmers, spoons, forks, spatulas and other cooking articles. However, she does not have a large enough quantity to satisfy a large demand or fast rotation in sales. Apart from that, Christiana is eager to get trained in order to be a better entrepreneur. Therefore, she turned to Zafen to obtain a loan and develop entrepreneurial talents.

loans.use: To buy dozens of cooking items to sell

loans.name: Prester

texts.en: Prester, aged 56, is running a sewing shop in Petionville, a suburb in Port-au-Prince. Born in that area, Prester started a mini-sewing shop with one machine at the age of 20. Prester learned to sew at a vocational school and received additional training from other institutions. Despite his current revenue, he has not been able to buy modern sewing machines and more fabrics to satisfy local orders. Therefore, Prester turned to Zafen to find a loan to make it possible.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and some textile fabrics in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Jose Dante

texts.es:
José Dante tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su hermano y ambos estan dedicados a la elaboración de muebles, poseen un local alquilado donde posee una carpintería, su comunidad es habitada por gente muy respetuosa y amable, la misma que esta ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

José Dante se dedica a la Carpintería, hace un año. Él necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima, pues necesita comprar una gran cantidad de madera para la elaboración de muebles y asi poder cumplir con con todos sus pedidos pedientes, y de esta manera podrá seguir con su record de buen trabajador y muy cumplido, lo que le a un mediado plazo le permitirá captar mayores clientes y por ende podrá aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias al igual su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Dante is 20 years old. He is single. He lives with his brother, and both of them make furniture. They have a rented space where they have a carpentry shop. Their community is populated by people who are very respectful and friendly. It is located in the district of Pucará in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

José Dante has been working in carpentry for a year. He needs the loan to purchase basic materials, since he needs to buy a great quantity of wood to make furniture and thus be able to fill all of his pending orders. In this way he will be able to continue with his reputation as a good and very accomplished worker, which in the medium term will allow him to attract more customers, and in the end he will be able to increase his income and improve his earnings as well as his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic materials for production

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is single and the mother of two. For more than five years, she has operated a general store in her village. Janice needs to add inventory capital to increase her sales because her business is the main source of income that absolutely supports her children's needs. 

Janice joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods for sale. She hopes that, in the future, her business will prosper. She wants to settle down, having a complete and happy family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Razel has been in this business for one year. Razel earns more income from her general store and raising pigs.

Razel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Wilian

texts.es:
El señor William con mucho esfuerzo y prestamos logro montar hace un mes un negocio de comercialización de alimentos, básicamente pollo asado y apanado, el negocio ha sido bien aceptado por sus clientes, pero presenta un gran problema el cual es el pago de sus deudas para montar el negocio que le ha dejado corto para surtir el local por lo que se ve muy urgido de apostar por un prestamos ya que pago algunas deudas con la intención de comprar materia prima para seguir operando. 
El crédito será de gran importancia pues ya casi acaba con las existencias y ha dejado de vender por no quedarse sin pollos para vender. 

Trabaja todos los días ayudado por su esposa y el crédito que solicita es para la compra de pollos, también comprara las salsas, servilletas, guantes plásticos, sal, bebidas, etc. 

Con el crédito podrá solucionar su problema y seguirá operando su negocio el cual es el único que le da sustento a él y su esposa para comer, para pagar servicios, un arrendamiento. Etc. etc.
texts.en:
Wilian, with great effort and loans, managed to establish a business a month ago.  He sells food, basically roasted and breaded chicken.  The business has been well-accepted by his customers.

However, there is a big problem.  Paying off the debt to establish the business has left him short to stock the place.  Therefore, it is urgent to opt for a loan.  He paid some debts with the intention of buying raw material in order to continue operating.

The loan will be very important.  He is almost out of stock, and he has stopped selling for the lack of chickens to sell.

He works every day, helped by his wife.  He will use the loan that he is requesting to buy chickens.  He will also buy salsas, napkins, plastic gloves, salt, and drinks, etc.  With the loan he will be able to solve his problem and continue operating his business.  The business is the only source of income for him and his wife to eat, to pay for services, and for rent, etc.

loans.use: to buy chickens, salsas, napkins, plastic gloves, salt, and drinks, etc

loans.name: Elsa Armida

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 35 años de edad, culminó sus estudios de noveno grado, no continuó por ayudarle a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar, actualmente está casada y es madre de dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. 

Elsa tiene un comedor, decidió abrirlo por ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella se traslada al negocio desde las 4:00 am para preparar los desayunos para atender y satisfacer a sus clientes, además una hermana le ayuda en el negocio. 


Este rédito lo necesita para  comprar dos mesas metálicas para usarlas en su negocio, y de esta forma darles mejor comodidad a sus clientes.

Su sueño es tener un negocio grande en el que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes, que le genere buenos ingresos para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Elsa is 35 years old. She finished her studies in ninth grade; she didn’t continue so that she could help her mother with the household tasks. Now, she is married and is the mother of two children who are studying. 

Elsa has a dining room; she decided to open it to help her husband with the household expenses. She works from 4:00am to prepare breakfast to take care of and to satisfy her clients. Her sister also helps in the business.

She needs this loan to buy two metal tables for use in her business. In this way, she will be able to offer more comfort to her clients. 

Her dream is to have a large business in which she will be able to better take care of her clients and that will earn a good income so that she can go forward with her family.

loans.use: to buy two metal tables for her business to help provide more comfort to her clients.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 40 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past four years, Erlinda has operated a business buying and selling salt and fermented fish in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of fermented fish and salt to offer for sale. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fermented fish and salt to sell

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años, estudió hasta cuarto grado de educación básica, actualmente vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando. 

María se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, ya que su esposo es el encargado de llevar el sustento a la familia, pues él se dedica a la albañilería. Además, María le ayuda a su esposo en la siembra de granos básicos al igual que sus hijos.


Ella necesita este crédito para comprar los materiales que hacen falta para terminar de construir su vivienda.

Su sueño es ver su casa terminada totalmente, y que sus hijos logren graduarse de una carrera en la universidad.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old. She went to school through the fourth grade of basic education. She now lives with her husband and their three children, who are in school.

Maria does the household tasks, since her husband is in charge of bringing sustenance to the family since he works as a mason. In addition, Maria helps her husband raise basic grains, along with their children.

She needs this loan to purchase the materials that are needed to finish building their home.

Her dream is to see her house completely finished and her children graduate from university programs.

loans.use: to buy materials that are needed to finish constructing her home.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz Elena tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su conyuge, en el sector de La Chacarilla, en casa propia, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa nrote de Perú.

Luz Elena se dedica a la crianza de animales menores hace más de 3 años, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y comida para estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con mayor número de variedad de animales, lo que le permitirá captar a un número mayor de clientes y asi podrá mejorar sus ingresos, sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Elena is 42 years old, is married, and lives with her spouse in her own house in the area of La Chacarilla, which is in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.

Luz Elena has been raising small animals for more than 3 years. She business is located behind her house. She requests this loan to buy animals and food for them. This investment will allow her to care for a wider variety of animals, which will help her get more clients and, thus, she will be able to improve her income, her earnings, and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals, so that she can take care of different requests from her clients.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 44 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Teresita has a business making accessories in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetable to sell. 

Renalyn has been in this business for three years. Renalyn earns more income from her general store.

Renalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetable to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a firewood and charcoal vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood and charcoal to sell. Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
Luz, una mujer de 42 años de edad que dio toda su vida en beneficio de su familia ayudándola a salir adelante y superando juntos las adversidades que se les han presentado en la vida, gracias a una tienda, que con mucho esfuerzo, paciencia y sacrificio logro montar. 

Ha generado los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia y buscando ser la mejor empresa familiar del sector, quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido como abarrotes, granos, bebidas y demás productos de la canasta familiar y de esta forma mejorar su inventario, además necesita realizar algunas mejoras locativas ya que quiere que su tienda tenga una mejor presentación para sus clientes.

Con este préstamo podrá impulsar su empresa y mejorara los ingresos que recibe de ella.
texts.en:
Luz is a woman of 42 who gives all her life for the benefit of her family, helping them to advance and overcoming together the adversities that have been presented to them in life, thanks to a store that she has managed to set up with much effort, patience, and sacrifice.

She has generated the income for the sustenance of her family and is trying to be the best family business in the sector. She wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of stock such as groceries, grains, beverages, and other products for the family food basket and in this way to improve her inventory. In addition, she needs to make some improvements in her business space, since she wants her store to have a better presentation for her customers.

With this loan she will be able to jump-start her business and improve the income that she receives from it.

loans.use: to buy products for the basic family food basket to stock her store, such as grains, beverages, and other products, and in addition to be able to make some improvements in her business space.

loans.name: Wagiman

texts.en: This is the story of Feri, son of Wagiman: I came from a poor family. My parents are farm workers whose works are based on demand, so the income is uncertain. It’s been hard for them to meet our daily needs. I just graduated from junior high and plan to continue my study in vocational school. I want to have a better life by achieving higher education. However, it seems impossible with my family’s current condition. I hope I can get the support I need from KIVA so I can continue my studies.

loans.use: to pay his education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Taking his passion and his skills, Jayson went into the barbering business for himself. Flexible hours and no middle man means he can spend more time with his family and provide them with a steady source of income. 

He has the skills, but starting on his own was harder than Jayson had originally thought. He wants to make his business as successful as he can, but equipment and materials are becoming too expensive. The cost of his  brushes, machinery, and other materials are hindering his business’ ability to thrive. Jayson is therefore requesting this loan to purchase the equipment and supplies he needs to keep his business and passion alive.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment and supplies he needs to keep his business and passion alive.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, who is married and has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for 10 years now, works hard to support her family. She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Alicia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 51 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

She has borrowed and paid off 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from food vending. Nelia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school. She has a rug making business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years. 

Victoria requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married and she is running a second hand business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as jackets, children's clothing, fine fabrics and kitchen appliances. She opened her business in 2006 with her own working capital of $500. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Francisca's husband is a trader. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people for improving their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy jackets, children's clothing, fine fabrics and kitchen appliances.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
This is the story of Dwi, daughter of Ida: I live with my mother, grandmother and one younger sibling who’s still in elementary school. My father left the village and went to Jakarta in search of better income. However, what he gets isn’t what he expected. It’s been hard for him to fund our daily lives.  

My parents always encourage me to continue my studies, and they don’t want to disappoint me, but I know that it will make things more difficult. I don’t want to give them more problems by continuing my studies. That’s why I hope I can get the support I need from KIVA so I can keep on studying just like what my parents want me to, without giving them more problems.

loans.use: to pay education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Vergensita

texts.en:
Vergencita continues selling cosmetic products in her community while running her transportation services at the same time. She earns a better income from these activities and has successfully repaid her previous loans used for the business. 

The business is doing well and she is now requesting another loan to buy additional cosmetic products. Vergencita wants to see her child become successful, so without a doubt she is saving a portion from her generated revenue for her child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase canned and bottled goods, noodles, and assorted foodstuffs to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nelia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and farming rice. Nelia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell in her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Violeta is 34 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for 20 years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more mangoes to sell to her customers. In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 39 years old, married, and has five children. With four children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

For 10 years Analy has run a general store in the Philippines selling a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, salt, noodles, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. She has requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy more such items to sell.

In the future, Analy would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, coffee, salt, noodles, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Diana works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling charcoal. 

Diana, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF, is borrowing PHP 15000 to purchase additional fish to make more dried fish to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Roderic

texts.en:
Roderic, 44, has been married for 15 years; his spouse works as a housewife, and they have three children, all of whom are dependent on him.

Roderic studied body repair mechanics in high school, but he has worked as an electrician for five years now to support his family. He studied a little for the trade. but it was an uncle who taught him everything. When he is not working as an electrician, he farms to earn extra income with the help of his wife. They work on this six-seven hours per day.

Roderic is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for his job as an electrician. He will buy a polisher, a drill and soldering equipment. This will allow him to be better equipped to do his job

Roderic's dream is to open his own electrical service company some day, because it is a business in high demand that allows him to support his family. He also dreams that his children will get a university degree.

loans.use: buy a polisher, a drill and soldering equipment.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 27 years old, married to Nicholas, and blessed with two children ages 10 and 12 years old. She has been in the motorcycle transport business for the past two years and earns a monthly income of 9,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her second loan of 22,500 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy a new spare wheel for her motorcycle so that she can serve her customers effectively.                                                                                           

The anticipated profit she will save and use to provide for the family basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and have a good living standard.

loans.use: to buy a new spare wheel for a motorcycle

loans.name: Suwarso

texts.en:
This is the story of Septi, daughter of Suwarso: I am the older child in my family. I have graduated from junior high school and plan to continue my studies in SMK Yos Sudarso Majenang, a vocational school. However, with our family’s current condition, it’s hard for me to do that. It’s hard for my parents to fund my studies since my father’s income as a laborer is barely enough to meet our daily needs. My mother can’t contribute much either.  

My parents have to take care of the younger child who still needs a lot of money to raise. As the older one, I want to be able to fund my studies myself.  That way, I won’t have to give them more trouble. Having learned about KIVA, I’m glad to find out there’s a hope for me. I need KIVA’s support to continue my studies.

loans.use: to pay education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla, 21 years old, is from the village of Mabangug. She is married and blessed with two kids. She is engaged in selling different products in the village. 

She is a very energetic person.  She wakes up early in the morning to display all the products that she can sell. After that, she cooks foods for her kids, while her husband is the one who stays in the store to entertain the customers. Priscilla is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 38,000 to buy canned goods, snack foods and drinks for her store.

In the future, Priscilla hopes that her business expands so that she can earn enough money for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 57 years old and married to Joseph. The couple is blessed with three children who are adults and in college. For the last 27 years, Ruth has been selling both new and old clothes and she earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES.
	 
Ruth is requesting for a loan of KES. 40,000 loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy stocks of clothing to sell. This will be her third loan. She will use the anticipated profit from her loan to pay school fees and also provide for her family’s basic needs. 


In the future, Ruth hopes to grow her business and open a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  ladies suits for sale

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Apolinaria is 49 years old, and has four children who are currently in school.

Apolinaria has a food vending business in the Philippines. Apolinaria requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  Apolinaria has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Apolinaria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Chrispel

texts.en:
Chrispel is 33 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children, with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Chrispel has been working hard to manage his clothing business, which deals in garments. 

To help expand his business, Chrispel has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials and suits, and will help Chrispel to generate greater profits and growth. Chrispel hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Chrispel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Chrispel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy materials and suits

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 40-year-old, widowed mother of two children aged 15 and 12 years old. She has been selling groundnuts for the last eight years to locals, and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000 (Kenyan Shillings). 

She has applied for her second loan from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to pay school fees for her children.

Elsa will use the remaining portion of the loan to buy more groundnuts to sell. She hopes to grow her business and to start selling a variety of cereals.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 45 years old. She is married to Sangala and together they have been blessed with five children between the ages of 22 years and 15 years.

Rachael sells clothing and shoes, a business she has done for the last 15 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 13,000. Rachael has requested her first loan of KES 25,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase clothes and shoes to sell.

With the anticipated profits, Rachael will be able provide for her family's needs as well as expand her current business.

Rachael's hopes and dreams are to educate her children beyond limits as well as provide sustainable basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Dahlia

texts.en:
Dahlia is 42 years old and married with three kids. She has managed a store for 10 years.  She sells different products in the community.  She is a very  loving mother, and she and her husband make sure they can provide for all the needs of the family. 

Dahlia is requesting a loan to buy noodles, candies, rice, sugar and spices for her store so as to have additional income to sustain the needs of the family. Dahlia hopes she can help her children finish their studies because according to her, this is the only thing that she can give to them.

loans.use: to buy noodles, candies, rice, sugar and spices for her store.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: Warlito has run a cafeteria for over ten years, earning well for the family. He has been able to sustain their living and also to support his children's education. Warlito used his generated revenue to successfully repay his previous loan used for the business. Warlito recently took a new loan to buy additional raw ingredients.
