Maria Jessa  requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Maria Jessa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

Susan will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a pick up. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ma. Belen

texts.en:
Ma. Belen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling frozen products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen products to sell.

Ma. Belen has been in this business for 30 years. She earns additional income from furniture making and pig fattening.

Ma. Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen products to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 21 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mary Jane has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ana, invirtió el préstamo anterior en materia prima para elaborar la comida que tiene a la venta, su negocio ha crecido, las circunstancias familiares son mejores y su situación económica es más estable.
Para elaborar mayor cantidad de comida con la que responderá  a la nueva demanda de sus clientes, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cacerolas, una cocina, gas propano, granos básicos, aceite, carnes, etc., tendrá equipado y surtido el negocio.  Su deseo es mantener su fuente de ingresos para continuar con su prosperidad.
texts.en: Ana invested her previous loan in raw materials that was used to prepare the food she sells. Her business has grown, her family circumstances are better, and her financial situation is more stable. To produce more food in response to the new demand of her clients she has decided to to request a new loan to buy pans, a kitchen, propane gas, basic grains, oil, meats, etc. to equip and stock her business. Her dream is to maintain her source of income and to remain prosperous.

loans.use: to buy pans, a kitchen, propane gas, basic grains, oil, meats, etc. to equip and stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a electronic equipment repair business.  He will purchase welding equipment, a polishing machine, a cutter and hand tools.  He will also fix up the room shown in the photo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new oven to enable his wife to make and prepare delicious food for the family inside their house.

loans.name: Arcadio

texts.en:
Arcadio, is aged 51, married and blessed with nine children. He sells fish in their village for a living, and he's been in this business for almost eight years earning a net income of PHP 300 daily. His net income from this business is usually spent on the school allowances for their children. 

Due to lack of capital to run his business, Arcadio would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase ten kilos of fish to sell. He's hoping that his business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase ten kilos of fish to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man, and he has one child. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, juices, soap, milk and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are locals. 

Peter will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items. His business goal is to excel within five years. Peter hopes that in the future, he will be a better business person. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a welding shop in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials like steel bars, aluminum, etc., for her welding shop.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 21 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like steel bars and aluminum for her welding business.

loans.name: Roseniana

texts.en:
Roseniana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Roseniana requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Roseniana has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married. He has two children. Ivan works as a taxi driver. He is a sincere and responsible person.

Ivan is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 UAH to do renovations at his house. He wants to change the floor, and insulate the walls with foam plastic and paint them.

loans.use: to do renovations at his house.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 49 years old and currently resides with her husband, Gilberto, in Manila, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than five years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner have to work hard and be determined to have a better income and to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To improve sales, Myrna would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 10,000 PHP, she could purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Myrna dreams that her business will continue to flourish. She hopes that her family will always have something to eat, and she also desires to give her children a good quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: G.s La Amistad Teupasenti Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos es una mujer  emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio que es venta de ropa nueva y de segunda mano actividad que realiza desde hace 24 años, cuenta con los clientes que son personas del municipio donde vive y de diferentes aldeas.
Doña Santos  realiza las ventas todos los días de la semana, también se dedica a la venta de zapatos de mujer y la venta de plata al por menor,  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, blusas, calcetines, suéter, vestidos, sandalias, etc. Espera que esta inversión le permita mejorar sus ingresos al igual que su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Doña Santos  sueña con poder hacer unos arreglos a su casa, solicita el  préstamo de forma grupal con las siguientes personas.
Don Henry se dedica al destazo y venta de carne de res desde hace 25 años.
Don Ricardo se dedica a la venta de Helados desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
Señora Santos is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her clothing sales business.  She has been selling new and second-hand clothing for 24 years.  Her customers and people from her own municipality and different towns. 
Doña Santos makes her sales every day of the week.  She also earns her living selling women's shoes and retail silver.  She is requesting the loan to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, socks, sweaters, dresses, sandals etc.  She hopes that this investment enables her to improve her income as well as her quality of life and her family's too. 
Doña Santos wants to be able to make some repairs to her house.  She is requesting this group loan with the following people:  
Don Henry has made his living for the last 25 years as a butcher and selling beef. 
Don Ricardo has made his living for the last 10 years selling ice cream.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, socks, sweaters, dresses, sandals etc. for her business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, 34, is a married woman with five children, three of whom currently are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evangeline has a native basket weaving business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her basket weaving business.

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni is 32 years old and married with one child. With her child currently in school, Laarni works very hard to provide for her family.

Laarni runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries, such as detergent soap, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, noodles, milk and cereals, to sell at her store.

Laarni has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, such as detergent soap, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, noodles, milk and cereals, to sell at her store.

loans.name: Villarina

texts.en:
Villarina works hard to support her family. Villarina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Villarina requested a 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Villarina has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Villarina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Visitacion

texts.en: Ma. Visitacion is an industrious and responsible mother to her child. She supports her child’s daily needs through her income in a retail store. She sells good products and hopes to continue acquiring more customers at her store. For this, she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy more merchandise to sell. She will buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, and sugar to sell. This will help increase sales capacity that will give her enough funds to sustain all their needs. She hopes to continue offering good products and friendly services to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena has been running a retail business for many years, earning well to provide for her family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She always wants improvements to her business because she wants a better living for the family. With this in mind, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods in order to increase sales.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy trays of eggs for her business.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional goods, such as wheat, bananas, oil, vegetables, tomatoes and rice.

Nieves started her business in 2003, with her own working capital of 5,000 PHP. She is happy with the loan offered by ASKI for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. This will help her increase her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat, bananas, oil, vegetables, tomatoes and rice to sell at her store.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is not married. She has owned a small café for two years. It is a good place with nice interior. She has coffee, fresh juices and many tasty desserts. Oksana chose to have a café with no alcoholic drinks and no smoking area. Parents with children can easily come to her place and enjoy it. Oksana is a very kind and hardworking person. 

Oksana is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 UAH to buy two refrigerators to store food.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators to store food.

loans.name: Jurine

texts.en: Jurine owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting vegetables and fruits. Aside from this, she has her pig business, growing pigs to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for this activity. It helped a lot in earning her living. Jurine is thankful to GDMPC for helping her to improve her agri-business activities. She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer, such as manure, to restore farm nutrients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer, such as manure, to restore farm nutrients

loans.name: Winny

texts.en: Winny is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be hail stones which destroy tea. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tea leaves. Her business goal is to prosper within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea leaves

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs. Letecia is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 55 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, milk, sugar and shampoo.

Soledad has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run her general store for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Her goal is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, milk, sugar and shampoo.

loans.name: Talha

texts.en:
Talha works hard to support her family. Talha is married and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Talha has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Talha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of bananas to sell.

Veronica has been in this business for 8 years. Veronica earns more income from farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Román

texts.es:
Román de 44 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, es divorciado y tiene dos hijas, una de 13 años de edad estudiando 9° grado y la otra de 11 años de edad estudiando 5°, actualmente Román vive con su madre pues con la separación dejó su antiguo hogar y la casa que tenía le quedó a su ex esposa y a sus hijas.

Él trabaja manejando camiones de un país a otro, desde hace 5 años realiza este trabajo el cual aprendió en Estados Unidos, también se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería pues eso le ayuda a generar más ingresos económicos.

El crédito lo necesitara para arrendar un terreno de 15 hectáreas para tener o pastar cuatro vacas y unas vaquillas, el crédito será de gran ayuda pues no tendrá que andar alquilando de un lugar a otro.

Él espera ser responsable con sus hijas aunque ya no esté con su esposa,  ayudarles en todo lo que pueda y darles el estudio que se merecen, esto lo lograra trabajando fuerte y ahorrando para hacer su sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Román is 44 years old and studied up to Grade 6. He is divorced and has two children. One is 13 years old and in Grade 9 and the other is 11 years old and in Grade 5. Román lives with his mother as he left his old home upon separation and the house was left to his ex-wife and their daughters.

He works driving trucks from one country to another. He has done this work which he learned in the United States for 5 years. He also works farming and raises livestock as this helps him to generate more income.

He needs the loan to rent 15 hectares of land to pasture 4 cows and some calves. The loan will be of great help as he won't have to go from one place to another renting land. He hopes to be responsible to his daughters even though he is still not with his wife, helping them all he can and providing them with the education that they deserve. He will achieve this working hard and saving to make his dream a reality.

loans.use: to rent a 15 hectare plot of land as pasture for his cattle.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 27-year-old married man. He studied till the secondary level of education. Unfortunately, he didn't complete his studies. 

Mohammed lives with his family in a humble house in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a very vigorous and ambitious young man and has a great determination to help his family with improving his house. The house where Mohammed and his family live lacks of many home appliances and most of the appliances they do have are very old and need to be replaced. As a first step from Mohammed to help his family with improving their living standards, he decided to purchase a bed room to make the house more comfortable and suitable for good living. For this reason, Mohammed applied for a Youth loan of 120,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a bed room for the house where he lives with his family.

Mohammed looks forward to improving the living conditions of his family. He hopes to build his own house and open a commercial store that will help him to further improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a bed room for the house where he lives with his family.

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Kotognogotala est un regroupement de femmes de Hamdallaye de Koutiala  qui se connaissent bien  et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 24 ans et ont au moins 2enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, d’Habillement, Tasses et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe.
Sali est un membre du groupe Kotognogotala,deuxième personne debout de droite à gauche, vendeuse de Friperie et des tasses. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de Friperie et des tasses qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kotognogotala comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 126000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Sali compte réaliser  175 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Kotognogotala is a group of women from the Hamdallaye [neighborhood] in the town of Koutiala who know each other well. They all live in traditional extended families with their husbands, children and other relatives. On the average, they are 24 years old, with at least two children each.
The group members sell miscellaneous items, such as clothing, dishes,  etc. In order to expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their third group loan.

Sali, one of the group members, is the second one standing from right to left in the photo. She is a vendor selling second-hand clothing and cups. She plans to use her loan to buy second-hand clothing and cups, to retail them later to a mixed clientele. She stocks up at the big market.
While other group members plan to earn an average revenue of 126,000 West African francs each during this loan cycle, Mrs. Sali plans to earn 176,000 francs. Apart from repaying their loans, the group members use part of their revenue to pay for personal expenses and bolster their work capital. They would like to strengthen their relationship with Soro Yiriwaso in order to avoid running out of stock.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing and cups.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 38 years old and lives in Garita, a part of Cabagan. For many years, he has continually run a transportation service. He bought a motorcycle as an addition to his business. His new motorcycle is not brand new, but it works well. Bernard is requesting a loan to buy a new set of tires to replace the old, used tires on his motorcycle. In the future, he hopes to continue his business improvements, as well as improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires to replace the old, used tires on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Vivalyn

texts.en:
Vivalyn is 40 years old, married, and has three children; two children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Vivalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase cooking oil, flour, and chicken.

Vivalyn has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Vivalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, flour, and chicken for her food vending business.

loans.name: Jesus David

texts.es:
Jesús es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo de plátano; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Valencia, Antioquia.

Este personaje tiene como propósito mejorar sus cultivos, es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes y la compra de semillas de Plátano.
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús is a modest and hardworking farmer with the drive and tenacity that distinguishes the men and women of the countryside. 

Jesús is a man with an enterprising mind who, from a very young age, learned all the trades associated with the countryside.  He learned farming and to raise animals such that today he has his own plantain crop.  He sells his produce in the Valencia, Antioquia municipal market. 

This character's goal is to improve his crop.  That is why he is turning to the help of a loan to purchase farming supplies, such as fertilizers, and plantain seeds. 

The loan will give Jesús the opportunity to progress as a business owner and as a person.  In addition, it will increase his income so he can continue contributing to his household. 

The only thing Jesús wants is to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family too.

loans.use: to pay for compost, seeds, irrigation and items for preparing his land.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a married man with one child. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. He describes his biggest business challenge as price fluctuations of fuel. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to repair his motorcycle and to buy fuel. His business goal is to own a public service vehicle within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and to buy fuel

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a business where he makes metal windows, doors and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to service his welding machine. His business goal is to have a big shop within five years.

loans.use: to service his welding machine.

loans.name: Temah

texts.en:
Temah is 45 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Temah has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buy and sell chicken.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ane Group

texts.en:
Neilyn is the featured borrower for ANE's group. She came from Philippines to Lebanon with her other group members to work as housekeepers in order to improve the poor living conditions of their beloved families in Philippines. They got together to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been friends since they came to work in Lebanon, as they are working hard to develop their living.

Neilyn is a 31-year-old divorced mother of four children. She left her home Philippines in an attempt to improve the poor living conditions of her family there, and satisfy her beloved children with a better life. She wants to pay her children’s school fees, thus she acquired the current loan. 

With respect to the other members of the group, Angie is 28-year-old single lady and Jennifer is 25-year-old single lady; they both want to send the money to their families to cover their increasing living needs.

Neilyn is standing on the left, while Jennifer is at the center of the picture, and Angie is the one standing on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To pay her children’s school fees

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming coconut.  Juanita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ebru

texts.en:
Ebru sells jewelry at the seaside. With the first loan she received this year, she rented a spot from the municipality to make sales at the seashore and purchased some more products. She made pretty good sales and good earnings. With those earnings, she later purchased jeans to widen her product range. She is waiting for her second loan to purchase some more jewelry and continue her sales until the end of November.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Ebru Hanım sahilde takı tezgahı  açıyor ve buradan satış yapıyor.  Ebru hanım bu sene bizden aldığı ilk kredi ile malzeme ve Belediyeden yer satın alıp satış yapmaya başlamıştı.  Satışları çok güzel gitmiş iyi kazanç elde etmiş.  Kendi kazancı ile kot pantolonlarda getirip satmış.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile de takı malzemeleri alacak ve kasım sonuna kadar satışlarını yapacak.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for resale

loans.name: Humura Abagambakamu Group

texts.en: Mary is 35 years old and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a member of Humura Abagambakamu Group. Members guarantee each other in order to access credit. She deals in retail and farming. Despite inadequate capital, she hopes to educate all of her children to higher levels of learning. Mary needs a loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, soap, matchboxes and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, soap, matchboxes and salt to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture and many of the simple home appliances for the house.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина молодая женщина в возрасте 27 лет. Она замужем, ее муж работает трудовым мигрантом в России. Парвина с маленьким ребенком живет в районе Кубадиён. Она занимается торговым бизнесом. Парвина на лавке продает продукты и сладости, а также параллельно она занимается куплей и продажей миндаля. Этой деятельностью она занимается уже 2 года. Парвина оптом закупает миндаль у дехкан и затем продает его на рынке района. Сейчас Парвина просит кредит для купли очередной партии миндаля. Этот кредит поможет увеличить ее бюджет.
texts.en: Parvina is a 27-year old woman. She is married; her husband is now in Russia as a migrant worker. Parvina lives in the Qubadiyon Region with their young child. She works as a vendor. She sells groceries and sweets from a stand. In addition, Parvina also buys and resells almonds. She has been in this business for two years. Parvina buys almonds from farmers wholesale and sells them at the regional market. At present Parvina is seeking a loan to buy a new batch of almonds. This loan will allow her to increase her budget.

loans.use: to buy almonds for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a married woman with three children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. She describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of cereals and vegetables. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cereals and vegetables

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en: Maxima is 58 years old, married to a farmer, and they're blessed with six children. She has sold rice grains and mungbeans in their village for almost fifteen years; she also sells vegetables for additional income. In this business she earns a net income of PHP 800 weekly. Due to insufficient funds she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 16,000 to purchase mungbeans and rice grains to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase mungbeans and rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Jacktone

texts.en: Jacktone is a married man. He has 3 children. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation of fuel. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to repair his motorcycle and buy fuel. His business goal is to own a public service vehicle within 5 years. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and buy fuel

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Estelita works hard to support her family.

She has a sweet potato business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Estelita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of sweet potatoes for her business.

Estelita has sustained her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of sweet potatoes

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 24 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Grace has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from farming coconut.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Rose a young farmer from Cheptonge a remote village in Kapsowar Kenya who has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. Rose is happily married and together with her husband they are blessed with 2 boys and 2 girls. Her primary source of income is milk and also she plants tomatoes on her farm and has named her tomato farm “ever blazing farm”. She also engages in personal business and has been able to earn a handsome profit from the venture. Rose practices agriculture with a difference employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge from the many agricultural training he has been attending to broaden her skills.

Although she earns handsome profits from farming she faces one big challenge and that is high prices in fertilizers, seedlings and inputs and this is a result of the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only agro vet shop in her area. She is requesting a loan to start an agro vet shop. Cheptonge area has only one agro dealer who is catering for thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on him for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a kill from farmers by charging them extra amounts since he is the only agro dealer and enjoys monopoly. Rose wants to change this and seize the business opportunity and through your loan she will start an agro vet shop and tap into the potential agricultural market. Rose will also help the smallholder farmers in his area who for a long time have been having a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs. Through your loan Rose will change from the peasant farmer she is right now to a certified agro dealer who will be depended on by nearly 9000 smallholder farmers in her area both for input, knowledge and information about improved inputs. Through increased income from the loan she will improve her living conditions and her future plans are to purchase a truck which will be used to engage farmers in output marketing activities.

Rose believes that there is no doubt that youths like her can find rewarding employment in farming. She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To start an agro vet shop

loans.name: Vibelyn

texts.en:
Vibelyn is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

Vibelyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Vibelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Vibelyn has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vibelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Vinia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Vinia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fish. Vinia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline, etc for her fishing business.

Vinia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 44 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal.  Leonida is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, iron, tubes and a welder in order to improve his work equipment

loans.name: Moslema

texts.en:
Moslema is a very young woman from Dhupguri.  She is only 21 years old, married and a mother of two children (a son and a daughter).  She is married to Safikul, a 28-year-old farmer.  They live in the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Moslema and her husband attended school until the third standard. Their children are in different grades in primary school.

Moslema's first priority is her children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing and education. She, along with her husband, has been doing the work of agriculture for many years. They raise different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  To cope with the growing price increase in essential commodities, they need to cultivate more crops.  They have decided to cultivate paddy on their farmland, as the crop is in high demand in the market.

In order to purchase seeds, insecticides and pesticides, Moslema applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). This would help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more income.

She aspires to construct a concrete-made house for them in the future and she wants to save money from her profit to fulfill her dream.

Moslema appreciates the help of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies in order to grow paddy

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is from Dhupguri. She is 31 years old and married with four daughters. Three of her daughters are going to school and are in grade 10, grade 7 and grade 5, respectively, while the other one is too young for school. Pratima is a homemaker who looks after her children, does all the household work and in her spare time, helps her husband with his farm work. She lives with her family in Harimandirpara in Jalpaiguri district.

Pratima's husband is a farmer. He is engaged in farming, growing rice and other vegetables. He has farmland, which is his investment and inheritance from his parents. He struggles hard to grow good quality products. He is a person who is looking out for his family's wellbeing. Moreover, his daughters are his greatest motivation in life and they are who he fights for in order to provide them with a good education. He wants to grow more paddies in order to earn more profits. 

Pratima is requesting a loan from BJS to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for rice cultivation. She believes that the loan will help provide all of the farming needs and in that way obtain higher revenues.  Thus, her husband will be able to improve the wellbeing of his family.

Pratima wants to upgrade their present house with the profit earned and she is thankful to her lenders, BJS, and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for growing paddy.

loans.name: Rajobala

texts.en:
Rajobala is a 51-year-old rural woman who lives with her husband and one son.  She was deprived of an education due to the poor economic resources of her family.  She is a homemaker who resides with her husband and son in the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri. Their son is a carpenter.

Her husband is a 61-year-old farmer who is unassuming and hardworking. He learned to work the fields as a child. This has enabled him to make progress. He grows paddy and vegetables on his farmland. Rajobala helps her husband with his farm work, especially at the time of harvesting and selling the produce in the market.

In order to grow their agribusiness, they decided to grow more paddies on their farmland. Thus, Rajobala has sought a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. With the support of this loan, she will buy agricultural supplies (seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies). With these supplies, she will continue to care for her crops and she will get a better harvest, with which she can generate more income when she goes to sell her crops.

With her enterprising spirit, her strength, and tenacity, Rajobala wants to continue to strive to accomplish her dream of having a concrete-made house where she can live with her family happily.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers to cultivate paddy

loans.name: Ergeshbai

texts.ru: Эргешбай, 43 года, женат, многодетный отец 6 детей, самому старшему сыну 20 лет, он самостоятельный, остальные живут с Эргешбаем и его супругой и помогают им по хозяйству. Эргешбай работает грузчиком, в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельских хозяйством, у него есть 2 коровы. Опыт в данном виде деятельности более 10 лет. Эргешбай  уважаемый человек, доброжелателен, пунктуален, корректен в общении, очень ответственный и предприимчивый. Недавно в его семье случилось несчастье, в доме произошел пожар, дом сгорел полностью. Теперь его семье фактически негде жить. Эргешбай уже продал 20 овец и 9 коров для постройки дома, однако средств катастрофически не хватает, также у Эргешбая есть другой кредит, который также нужно гасить. Поэтому Эргешбай обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за льготным кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на рефинансирование кредита и постройку дома. Кредит поможет Эргешбаю восстановить его дом, позаботиться о своей семье и сохранить скот.
texts.en:
Ergeshbai is 43 years old, married, and the father of a large family (he has six children).  His oldest son is 20 years old and already living on his own.  The other five children live with Ergeshbai and his wife and help him with the family business.  Ergeshbai works as a freight handler, but in addition to his job, he is also involved in agriculture and he currently owns two cows.  He has more than ten years of experience in this type of work.  

Ergeshbai is a respected man; he is friendly, punctual, a good communicator, very responsible and he has an enterprising spirit.  Recently his family experienced a very unfortunate event: their house was completely destroyed in a fire and they literally have no place to live anymore.  Ergeshbai has already sold 20 sheep and 9 cows to rebuild his house, but he is still in dire need of money, especially since he has another loan which he needs to repay.  For all these reasons, he has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a preferential loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to refinance his previous loan and rebuild his house.  This loan will help him to rebuild a new home, take care of his family and keep his livestock.

loans.use: to rebuild his house, destroyed in a fire, and to refinance a previous loan.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
23-year-old Sabita is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from Dhupguri. She is married with one young daughter. They live in the small village of Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district.

Sabita's husband is a carpenter whose income is hardly sufficient for the family. So, to help her husband financially, Sabita runs her own cattle-rearing business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she is able to support her family and save for a secure future. However, this young ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to expand her business by selling milk products like butter, curd and cottage cheese.

Sabita seeks to take a loan from BJS to buy a new dairy cow. With the expansion of business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Sabita will be able to reach her goal, which includes constructing a new and better house.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Sahera

texts.en:
Sahera, age 26, is a married woman.  She is from Dhupguri. She is an illiterate homemaker who is blessed with one son who reads in grade two and one daughter who is a toddler. She lives in the small village of Madhyapara in Jalpaiguri district.

Sahera's husband deals in the business of selling animals. Sahera is involved in this business with her husband. They buy baby goats, raise them, and sell their milk to her neighbors. Sometimes they sell them in the market when they grow up. 

Now they want to grow their business. For this reason, Sahera applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase more goats. Her husband is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, he will definitely expand this business and increase their income level. Sahera is very much hopeful that with the help of the loan, she can prosper in the business.

She appreciates the financial help of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase goats for her livestock business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has operated a general store, with the help of her husband, for many years in order to make a living. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business and was able to save for her child's future education. 

She works to improve her business to ensure a better source of income for her family in the future. She took a new loan recently to purchase more grocery goods to sell. In the future, Mary wants to improve her business and the general living of her family as well.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 33 years old and married with three children, one child attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Jasmin has a fishing business in the Philippines and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.  She has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Jasmin would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en:
Fredeswinda is a 68-year-old widow with ten children. 

Fredeswinda has raised pigs for 25 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 20 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Fredeswinda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is only 19 years old. At this tender age, she is married and a mother of one toddler. She is married to Bipul, who is a land cultivator.  Sultana has a secondary education.  The family lives in Harimandirpara in Jalpaiguri district.

Her husband raises seasonal fruits and vegetables on their farmland. He is a skilled person in this field with six years of experience. Sultana helps her husband with the farming. They usually sell the crop in the local market. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Now they decided to cultivate paddy.

Sultana needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. So she applied for a loan from BJS. This will allow her to cultivate paddy, which is a crop in great demand in the market, and increase her monthly turnover.  This way, she can increase the profitability of her business and ensure her financial stability so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

She conveys her hearty thanks to the lenders for this financial assistant.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to grow paddy

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is 26 years old. She is married and a housewife. She is illiterate and can only sign her name.  She is blessed with one son. They live in a remote region of Jalpaiguri district in their own mud and straw-made house, which lacks the basic facilities like water and electricity.

Minati's husband Ukil is 43 years old and a farmer by profession. He mainly grows vegetables like potatoes, gourds, ladies fingers, beans etc.  He grows quality products and his prices are less expensive. So his number of customers is increasing gradually. Now he wants to cultivate eggplant. 

Thus, Minati is requesting a loan to buy eggplant seeds, pesticide, fertilizer, etc. to grow eggplant, which they hope will be a good harvest. With the profit from this business, they hope they can secure their lives in terms of food, health and education.

Minati aspires to purchase more land with the profit in the future.

She is thankful for BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for eggplant cultivation.

loans.name: Remyna

texts.en: Remyna lives in Piat with her children. She is managing a pasalubong center (souvenir store) selling foods to the people in her village. She sells glutinouss, rice desserts, coconuts, and assorted snacks ideal for souvenirs. Remyna is asking for an additional loan of 25,000 PHP to invest in her business. She will buy more glutinous rice and coconut to cook and sell in her stall. She hopes this loan will be given to her because she is managing two stalls. Additional income will continue diversifying her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and vinegar to sell

loans.name: Nditi

texts.en:
Nditi is a 49-year-old hardworking woman who is married to David, they have 2 children.  She adds additional income to their family by operating a livestock farming business for ten years.  She earns 40,000 KES every month.

Nditi was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and she intends to buy additional cows and livestock feed which  will be more nutritional for her  herd.

Nditi plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children to higher levels and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy additional cows and livestock feed.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 37-year-old man, married to Keziah, who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with two children. Joshua has been operating a cleaning detergents business for five years earning himself an income of 10,000 KES at the end of every month.

Joshua was introduced to VisionFund Kenya and is now servicing his first loan of 15,000 KES and intends to use this amount to buy cleaning detergents to sell to his customers.

Joshua plans to use the anticipated profits to open up a shop of his household products. He hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy cleaning detergents to sell to his customers

loans.name: Beteliana

texts.en:
Beteliana is a 52-year-old married woman with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a retail dry goods business for 10 years and requests 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase dry goods to sell.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods stock to sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila supports her family through her food vending and general store business in the Philippines.  Her daughter Kimberly is 18 years old and is the 4th of the four children in the family.

Kimberly is studying to earn a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently in her 3rd year of the 4-year course.  Teofila is borrowing 7,821 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the 2014-2015 school year.

Kimberly plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Aiby

texts.en:
Aiby is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Aiby has been in this business for 23 years and earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Aiby has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa is a 55-year-old married woman with seven children, 1 attends school. 

Alfonsa has has a dried fish making business  for 5 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish and other ingredients for her business.

Alfonsa would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna, 27 years old, is from Dhupguri town. She lives with her husband and three children (one son and two daughters). She is illiterate but her children's education is her first priority.  She is providing an education to her children. Two of them are in grade three, and one is too young for school.  She is married to Gautam and they live in a remote region of Jalpaiguri district named Gosairhat.

Swapna's husband is an experienced farmer. With the help of Swapna, he is engaged in land cultivation. He cultivates green vegetables and cucumbers. The family sells the products in the local market and that is the most important source of their income.

As autumn is coming, Swapna needs to make some investments in her agricultural business in order to cultivate paddy. She wants to develop their agribusiness in a sustainable way and to be more productive. She needs financial help.

So Swapna has sought a loan from BJS to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for paddy cultivation. She expects a good harvest as autumn is the most suitable season for paddy cultivation. Swapna and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agricultural business.

Her goal is to provide a better education to her children to reach to a successful future and she thanks her lenders for their help.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Nemreh

texts.en:
Nemreh is a 57-year-old single Palestinian refugee. Thirty-one years ago, she started tailoring clothes from her house to cover her living expenses and needs without any help from her siblings due to their low financial and social conditions. 

Nemreh is a hard worker and a talented tailoring professional, as she is known among her customers for her quick service, and good quality product

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy a more developed tailoring machine that will help provide her customers with the best and fastest service and increase her income.

Nemreh always hopes to open her own tailoring shop where can reach more customers and provide them with fashionable clothes.

loans.use: To buy a more developed tailoring machine

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia  has helped her husband work their farm. Their income has meet the family's needs for over six years. She successfully repaid a previous loan.  

Farming is their main source of income and the  couple wishes to improve the farm. She requests a loan to buy additional organic fertilizer. She plans  to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer.

location.town: La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 44-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school, Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 8 years and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy chips, soft drinks, and eggs.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy chips, soft drinks, and eggs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 37-year-old married woman with three children, 2 attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Analyn has had a motorcycle transportation business for 6 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools to maintain her motorcycle.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for her motorcycle

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 50-year-old married woman with 5 children, 1 child attends school.

She has grown vegetables for 15 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional seed and fertilizers.

She has previously borrowed 6 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is 45-year-old married mother of six children. Due to the low social and financial situations of her husband, she started working in tobacco cultivation to cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Ibtisam works hard and sacrifices a lot to provide her beloved kids with a better future. This in an attempt to increase her income. She decided nine years ago to start making and selling “Mouneh” and distilled plant water from her house in addition to cultivating tobacco as an additional income business. 

Today, Ibtisam is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to make necessary maintenance to her house, which is her business center, and make it a healthier living place for her beloved kids, before the coming autumn and winter seasons. 

Ibtisam is trying hard, through her two businesses, to satisfy all of the needs of her children and guarantee a better future for them.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to her house, which is her business center, and make it a healthier living place for her beloved kids, before the coming autumn and winter seasons

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is married with one child. He operates a service-based business in their community to make a living. His wife is working abroad as an Overseas Filipino Worker. Aside from this, he also has a retail store and a tenant of his vehicle. He earns well from these activities and his returns were successfully used in farming. His previous loan used for these activities has been repaid successfully. He took a new loan recently to cover motor maintenance costs as well as a portion to buy grocery goods to sell. In the future, Patrick is determined to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to cover motor maintenance costs as well as a portion to buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 60-year-old widow with 5 children, 1 child attends school. Angelina works very hard to provide for her children.

Angelina has run a general store for 6 years and requests 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase detergent, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, and coffee. 

Angelina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, and coffee.

loans.name: Batiana

texts.en:
Batiana is 51 years old and single with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Batiana is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Batiana has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Cherry is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Cherry has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from furniture making. Erlinda is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sewing materials for her tailoring business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials for her business

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 36 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Consolacion has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 64 years old and married with eleven children, three of whom are in school. Joyce works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell .

Joyce has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Joyce would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 47 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   

Valentina has a business selling ice cream in the Philippines. Valentina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients like salt, sugar and milk for her ice cream.

Valentina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Valentina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like salt, sugar and milk to make ice cream.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spices to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spices to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 52 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Norma has a business selling footwear in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of slippers, shoes and other footwear.

Norma has been in this business for two years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of slippers, shoes and other footwear.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married with five children. She is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines.                             

Alma is a farmer and grows palay crop to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer and pesticides.                                                             

Alma has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Alma hopes to harvest more palay crops.

loans.use: To pay for five sacks of fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Alis

texts.en:
Alis is a 57-year-old woman married to John, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children. Alis is a farmer who has been operating an agricultural business for ten years, earning an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

Alis is now servicing her fourth loan of KES. 11,250 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to boost her farming plantation by buying fertilizers and seedlings.

Alis plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her grandson and open a grocery stall. She hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old and has three children.  She is married and all of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Rosa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

She has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 49 years old and married with eight children, two of whom in are school. Antonieta works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Antonieta has been in this business for three years.

In the future Antonieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en: Jelyn has been helping her husband manage their own farm to make a living. For over six years, she has earned a good income to sustain their needs. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for farming. It is doing well so she is hopeful for an improvement in her income. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional organic fertilizer.  In the future, Jelyn wants to provide a good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana, a 51-year-old mother of one, has been helping her husband work their own farm to make a living. With her farm, she is able to sustain her family's needs as well as send her child to school. She joined GDMPC last year and borrowed a new loan to buy planting materials and organic fertilizer. In the future, she plans to cultivate their vacant lot to earn more for the family.

loans.use: to buy planting materials and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 47 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Myrna aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Arlene is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, vegetables, etc for her food vending business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Asiscla

texts.en:
Asiscla is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Asiscla is 47 years old and her four children are in school.

Asiscla has a general store business in the Philippines. Asiscla requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Asiscla has been in this business for six years. In the future, Asiscla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Abita

texts.en: Abita is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Lore

texts.en:
Lore is 50 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Lore is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lore has been pig fattening for 18 years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, etc.

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 40 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Carmelita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as seasonings, juice, cereals, sanitary pads, noodles, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married with three children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Elsie is a farmer and grows corn and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy eight sacks of fertilizer.

Elsie has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Elsie hopes to provide a decent and successful business.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is 46 years old and she is happily married to Rizaldy, who is a security guard. God has blessed them with five loving children and three of them are already studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Marina owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, an egg, and other things. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she sells it per piece for a higher price to have profit. She also offers prepaid load services and she buys and sells processed food products for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby and the people in the community. She earns Php 1000 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a Php 35,000.00 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Marina desires to have her own burger stand and that her variety store will soon become a grocery store. She also hopes to have a better life someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is 32 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Jackielyn has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Cecilia has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Abdoul Aziz

texts.fr: ABDOUL AZIZ est un jeune homme marié et père de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation des habits pour bébé (Bambine rie). Il n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Il a une expérience de plus de 10ans et sollicite ce montant pour  renforcer son stock de marchandises et satisfaire ses clients. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir il souhaite disposer de son propre magasin et diversifier ses marchandises. Ainsi, il pourra augmenter ses revenus et construire une grande maison pour le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abdul Aziz is a young married man and father who is active in the baby clothing market (Bambinerie). He has no relatives who are beneficiaries of the institution.

He has over 10 years' experience and is requesting this amount to increase his stock of merchandise and satisfy his customers. He manages his family's daily expenses and begins his day at 9 am to finish at 7 pm.

In the future he wants to have his own shop and diversify his merchandise. This way he can increase his income and build a large house for his family's welfare.

loans.use: buy children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 54 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell. Merlinda has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run her general store for one year. She also earns an income from pig fattening. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 31-year-old widow with three children living in Kasese Uganda. She has been in the retail business for the last four years and works eight hours a day seven days a week. She does  farming  for supplementary  income. After the death of her husband, Jane began the business to have a source of income to enable her to educate her children. Business expansion is her dream though competition and inadequate capital are a challenge. Jane wants to buy sugar, salt, soap and rice to sell.
