loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap and rice to sell

loans.name: Benito

texts.en: Benito lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. His wife sells fruits and vegetables in the market. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with the income from selling only fruits and vegetables, he has found ways to earn more income through snack and food vending. It began with selling a small amount of food and snacks to his neighbors. He joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, which helped him in the capitalization of his sari-sari (small grocery) store in January 2004. He became a member, and has received loans several times already. Now, he applies for a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy merchandise for his sari-sari store. He hopes that his business will grow and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his sari-sari store

loans.name: Luzmaria

texts.en:
Luzmaria is 36 years old and single.

Luzmaria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.

In the future Luzmaria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 41-year-old Palestinian refugee and married mother of two children. She lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp. The financial and social situation of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon is difficult, especially for those who live in a camp. Due to the limited income of her husband, she decided four years ago to open her own clothing shop inside the camp to help to cover her family's expenses.

Hanan is a hard worker and has a good reputation in her region. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise and offer new fashionable clothing for the upcoming autumn season. Hanan hopes this loan will help her increase her monthly income and save for a better future for her beloved children.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise and offer new fashionable clothing for the upcoming autumn season.

loans.name: Hawa's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 12 juillet 2008 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience de plus de 05 ans dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes du même village et partagent des liens forts de solidarité et d’entraide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’agriculture pendant l'hivernage.

Madame Hawa (assise à l’extrême droite levant la main), est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants dont 05 filles. Son activité consiste à l’achat et la revente de produits de consommation de base de la localité à savoir : le sucre, le savon, le thé vert et divers épices qu’elle achète au  marché international hebdomadaire non loin de sa commune pour la revente en détail au village.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte s'investir davantage dans cette activité et utiliser les bénéfices pour appuyer son mari dans la prise en charges des besoins de la famille surtout pour la nourriture et scolarité.
texts.en:
Created July 12, 2008 at the opening of the "banc villageois" loan association, this group consists of women who have over five years' experience in the "banc villageois" program. They are all from the same village and share strong bonds of solidarity and mutual aid. Their main activity is small retail trade and agriculture during the rainy season. 

Mrs. Hawa (seated at the far right raising her hand), is the group's representative. She is married and the mother of nine children of whom five are girls. Her business is buying and selling basic local necessities namely sugar, soap, green tea and various spices. She buys at the weekly international market near her municipality for retail sales in the village.

She will use the new credit loan to become more involved in this activity and use the profits to support her husband in taking charge of the family's needs, especially for food and schooling.

loans.use: buy two 50-kilo bags of sugar, a box of 24 bars of soap, a box of green tea and spices.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rattan business in the Philippines. The vines are used for furniture making. 

She is borrowing PHP13,000 through NWTF to buy additional rattan to sell. Marilyn has been in this business for six years. Marilyn earns more income from buying and selling rice.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional rattan to sell for her business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 61 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase chips, eggs, milk, sugar and canned goods etc to sell.

Violeta has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chips, eggs, milk, sugar and canned goods, etc to sell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 56 years old and lives in Alegria, Pag. City ZDS. She is married with 4 children.                   

Luzminda has a shop that sells assorted grocery products and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy assorted grocery products.                                                                         

Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Luzminda hopes to extend her business to other neighboring barangay.

loans.use: To pay for assorted grocery products.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is 29 years old, married with eight children and lives in Kasese, Uganda.  She operates a retail shop with general merchandise and has been in this business since 2000.  She also sells cassava flour where she gets an additional side income. She began this business to improve her standards of living.  She dreams of providing better services to her customers despite having limited capital.  Constance wants money to buy salt, sugar, maize flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, maize flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Ravshanjon

texts.en: Ravshanjon comes from a rural area. He is a young and smart boy. Ravshanjon is a student of the University. He studies well and reads a lot of books. Ravshanjon lives with his parents and his father is a driver. Ravshanjon’s father has not had an opportunity to obtain higher education. So, he was glad when Ravshanjon applied to the University. Ravshanjon and his family live poorly as the income from his father's driving job is small. Ravshanjon must pay for his University tuition so he is asking for a loan of 1300 USD. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shellfish

loans.name: Delita

texts.en:
Delita is 34 years old, married, and has children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Delita is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation.

Delita has been farming rice for seven years and also earns additional income from selling charcoal. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation

loans.name: Onelia Liset

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleada de una sastrería de su comunidad.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. Ella es Onelia de 37 años de edad y con grandes aspiraciones en superar en la vida ella tiene 3 hijos que son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad.
La actividad que ella dignamente realiza en la comunidad donde ella vive es modista y costurera, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 8 años ella aprendió esa actividad gracias a que una gran mujer que tenía una confección de ropa en la comunidad, lo contrato y ella aprendió y se decidió a emprender ella también dicho negocio ya que deja muy buena ganancia para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
El uso que ella dará al crédito realizado es para la remodelación de su vivienda ya que las condiciones de vida que ella tiene no son las adecuadas para habitar y es por ello que se ha decidido a realizar un préstamo para remodelar su casa así tener las condiciones de vida adecuada para ella y su familia. Una de las grandes aspiraciones de ella es instalar un local en el centro de su comunidad para tener ventas mayores son las que ahora realiza y dar estudios a sus hijos para que ellos sean profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Onelia, 37, has big aspirations of improving herself in life.  She has three children who are excellent students in the school in her community.

Life gave her the opportunity to work as an employee of a tailor shop in her community.  It was what she wanted, not only an open door but what what behind that door.  And she found something that defined what she wanted to be.

She makes an honest living in her community as a dressmaker and seamstress.  She has done this work for eight years.  She learned it thanks to a great woman with a garment shop in the community who hired Onelia.  She learned and decided to set herself up in this business as well, because it earns her a good profit to improve her family's living conditions.

She's going to use the loan to refurbish her house.  Her living conditions are not suitable, so she decided to get a loan to remodel and have suitable living conditions for herself and her family.

One of her biggest goals is to set up a store in the center of her community to have more sales than she does now.  She also wants to give her children an education so they'll be professionals in the various professions in their community.

loans.use: to refurbish her home

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is a widow and has been earning a living by selling fish in the village for over twenty years.  

She has sustained their living through this business and, to increase her inventory, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more fish to sell. 

She wants to improve her business by having her own stall in the market.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 48 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Gemma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gemma has been pig fattening for 7 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 59 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for two years now, and she has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Pacita has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family .

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Edely

texts.en:
Edely is 21 years old and married with one kid.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Edely is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Edely has been raising pigs for two years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elma is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

Elma has been farming rice for six years, and also earns additional income from buy and sell rattan (vines use for furniture making).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 41-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has a tailoring business and has been doing that for eighteen years. She also practices farming, which gives her additional income. She began the business to look after herself. Dorothy is a hardworking woman with a hope of expanding her business into a training center.

Dorothy is faced with the challenges of limited capital and competition. She needs a loan to buy clothes for mending and a tailoring machine.

loans.use: to buy clothes for mending and a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizer for her rice-farming business.

Janet has been in this business for 4 years. Janet earns additional income from buying and selling rattan.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! The above picture presents Alice, a mother of two who has been practicing agriculture for the last 17 years. 

Because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect among other farmers and she is viewed as a mentor in her village. She lives together with her children in the Kerugoya area of Kenya, which is known for coffee plantations for export. 

Her primary income sources are eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Generating an income through selling harvest is the part of farming she enjoys most. Availability of labour is a major challenge for Alice. She also keeps a dairy cow. 

Before joining Juhudi, Alice could not access loans from banks since they considered her a high risk client. She mobilized marginalized farmers and created the group Maendeleo Kasarani. Through the group, she joined Juhudi Kilimo and learnt about loan management and agribusiness. She also got to learn about Kiva. 

Alice is seeking a loan for constructing a cow shed and to purchase farm implements. With your loan, Beatrice will introduce zero grazing (an environmentally sound method of cattle care) and purchase more effective modern tools that will make her farm activities much easier. This will boost her income and enable her to pay school fees for her children. 

Alice waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements

loans.name: Jabbor

texts.en:
Jabbor is a hardworking man. He has higher education. Jabbor has worked in a state organization more than 22 years. He is one of the best workers and has a great opportunity in this field. 

Jabbor is a careful father for his children. Now, his son is a student of the first course of Management State University of Tajikistan. He studies at the faculty of international attitude. He studies full-time. 

Jabbor must pay for university tuition, and with this aim he is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to pay the university tuition of his son. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is 55 years old, married, and has six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ursula has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Ursula is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
This is Maribeth, 40, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines, and a mother to her two children. Her husband is Edgar, a vendor. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Maribeth operates an accessories retail business. She buys accessory items from wholesalers and sells them per piece with a profit. Products are items like beaded jewelry such as necklaces,  bracelets, earrings and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Maribeth dreams that her children will finish their studies and she also hopes for a successful and prosperous life in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of jewelry and other accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 29 years old, married, and has four children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has sold palm oil for the last 11 years. She also does brick laying for additional income. She began the business after dropping out of school.  

Scovia has a dream of educating her children, buying land and expanding her business despite competition and limited capital. Scovia needs the loan to buy palm oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Gjevat

texts.en:
Gjevat is a father of two sons and two daughters between the ages of 1 and 26 years old. 

In order to earn a living, he works in a bakery while his wife stays home to care for the house and children. They live in very poor conditions because of his low salary and the area that they live in. 

The lavatory and kitchen are both in urgent need of renovation and he would like a loan to finally get them fixed. He is very happy for this opportunity to improve their living conditions and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To renovate the kitchen and lavatory.

loans.name: Novica

texts.en:
Novica comes from one of the minority communities in Kosovo. He is 52 and single, living by himself in a small house. He has never been married and his parents are both deceased. 

In order to earn a living he sells wood for heating, and he plants corn and wheat to harvest and sell. For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase new tools to work on his land. He is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new tools to work on his agricultural land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a small cart to transport coffees and edible items, so she can offer employment to another persona and impact someone from her community.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 46-year-old Palestinian refugee and married mother of four children. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon and their limited work access, she decided, five years ago, to work as a hairdresser running her business from her house, to help her husband in covering their beloved family’s living expenses and needs.

Nadia learned hairdressing from a specialized vocational college, and she has gained a good reputation for her professional skills in this domain, as she moves from one house to another to provide her customers with very creative and fashionable hairstyles.

Today, Nadia is acquiring a Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary hair tools that will facilitate her work and provide her customers with more fashionable hairstyles. She will also benefit from this loan to help her husband who owns a hookah café to develop his business.

Nadia is working hard to increase her income and provide a better future for her beloved kids, as she hopes she will be able to own a hairdressing salon in the upcoming future and become a very famous and professional hairdresser.

loans.use: to buy necessary hair tools that will facilitate her work and provide her customers with more fashionable hairstyles

loans.name: Alberto Trinidad

texts.es:
Alberto prepara uno de los mejores petos de  su pueblo natal. , el peto es una bebida a base  de Maíz blanco, a la que agregan en su preparación agua,  azúcar, leche, sal, canela,  
remojando el maíz desde la noche anterior, para ser  cocinado en el agua y la sal, se le agrega leche y el azúcar, se baja el calor sin dejar de remover, dejándolo un poco espeso, para ser servido. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años cuando inició por ser una alternativa generadora de ingresos, después de haber quedado discapacitado, sin su pierna,  cuando caminaba y pisó una mina hace 13 años.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y sus principales clientes son los estudiantes empleados y la comunidad en general que le compra la deliciosa  bebida. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikva, primer financiamiento  que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado, maíz azúcar, canela y también invertirá en hacer un carro de perros, donde adicionar la venta de comidas rápidas. Su mayor anhelo es apoyar la educación de su hijo de 3 años, y por eso tiene el gran desafío de trabajar persistentemente para poder ahorrar y lograr sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Alberto makes one of the best "petos" in his hometown.  Peto is a drink made of white corn with the addition of water, sugar, milk, and cinnamon.  The corn is soaked the previous night, then cooked in the water and salt.  The milk and sugar are added, the heat is lowered, and the peto is stirred constantly until thickened a little for serving.

He started this job 10 years ago because it was an alternative source of income after he became disabled.  He was left without a leg 13 years ago when he stepped on a land mine while walking.  He makes his sales in cash, and the main customers who buy his delicious beverage are students, employees, and and the community in general.

Currently Alberto's requesting a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy corn, sugar, and cinnamon wholesale and in cash.  He'll also invest in making a hot-dog cart so he can add fast food sales.

His biggest desire is to pay for his 3-year-old son's education.  That's the reason for the big challenge of working persistently to be able to save and realize his dream of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, and cinnamon, and to make a hot-dog cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bugombwa Kweyimukya Group

texts.en:
Josephine, whose hand is raised in the group, is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, and her business is cocoa buying and selling. She works very hard to run her business and earn a living, and most important, to look after her children. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations, which at times lead to losses. 

She wants the loan to pay school fees for her children, and the balance will be injected into her business.

loans.use: To pay school fees and add the balance to her business.

loans.name: Babra

texts.en: Babra is 27 years old and married with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For ten years Babra has been running a textile shop along with raising poultry and running a canteen. She began the business to have multiple sources of income to support her family. She has a dream of educating her children in better schools and having a good home in spite of her limited capital. Babra needs a loan to buy clothes such as dresses, shirts, bed sheets and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as dresses, shirts, bed sheets and other items to sell

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 53 years old, married, and has three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Amelia has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Amelia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nexhmije

texts.en:
Nexhmije is a married mother of two children. Her husband works as a driver for a clinic but he has very low income and Nexhmije helps to add to the family’s income. For more than 15 years she has operated her own handicraft business from home. 

She is very satisfied with her job and loves what she does. She is very optimistic that in the future she will be able to own a shop. Right now, she is in need of a loan in order to purchase materials for her work. The loan will help her to earn more income and be able to better satisfy the needs and requests from her customers. She is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her work

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en:
Bajram is 41 years old and the father of seven children between the ages of 2 and 18 years old. Six of them are attending school. They came from the Ashkali community and are struggling in the poor economic situation of the community to improve their standard of living. 

For the last 14 years, in order to earn a living, he has cut wood to sell to others for heating while his wife stays home and cares for their children. After so many years of working, his machine is old and needs to be replaced. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new machine to allow him to work more effectively and be more efficient. He is hoping that will provide him with more than enough work to improve his family’s living conditions and offer his children a better education. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine to allow him to work more effectively and be more efficient.

loans.name: Sanja

texts.en:
Sanja is 27 yeas old and the mother of two children, ages 5 and 7. Together, they live in one of the minority communities of Kosovo. 

In order to earn a living, her husband works as a taxi driver, but his salary is low and they live in very bad conditions that she wants to improve. She has not been able to manage any improvements or repairs on the home because she had not been working while her children were very small. 

Now, she is requesting a loan to replace the doors and windows before the winter so that she can better insulate the home and keep it dry. The loan will help her improve their living conditions and be able to offer her children better health and a better environment. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To replace the doors and windows of her house.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 24-year-old woman married to Peter who adds additional income to support his family.  They are blessed with three children. Lucy has been operating a clothing business for four years, earning an income of KES 7,000 at the end of every month.

Lucy was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000 and intends to use this amount to buy suits, shirts, shorts, dresses, blouses and shoes to sell to her customers.

Lucy plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future by opening a boutique shop in the town.

loans.use: to buy suits, sweaters, shirts, dresses, shorts and shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Renestina

texts.en:
Renestina, aged  47 years, is married with six children and living in Kasese, Uganda.  

Renestina practices agriculture growing crops such as gnuts (Ugandan groundnuts), maize, beans, and cotton for selling. Renestina started the business to get a daily source of income to support her family after realizing that her husband's income was inadequate to educate her children. 

She is hardworking, with a dream of educating her children. However, weather changes like floods and too much sun affect her business. Renestina wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa, 40, is a mother of 5 children ranging from 9 – 19 years old. They all live in very poor conditions, like most people in their Roma community. Her husband transports goods for others while she is employed cleaning the bus station. 

Their home is very old and has never been repaired because of their lack of income. Now, she is very happy to have the opportunity to request a loan to fix the home and provide better living conditions for her family. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To fix her home and provide better living conditions for her family

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa is the mother of three children. She is a housewife while her husband is a driver for a hospital. Although his salary is enough to meet their daily needs, it is not enough for him to be able to make any repairs or renovations. 

The house that they are living in has not been repaired for a long time and needs new windows and doors. This loan will help them to save electricity during the winter and keep them healthier. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to change doors and windows  to save electricity during the winter and keep her family healthy.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her retail business. The loan is also useful in the education of her child who is now in college. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise needed to expand her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda hopes for her business to continue to flourish and she dreams of a well-off living for her family. She is an active community partner of C.C.T. She meets with her fellowship* group every Tuesday.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different accessories and merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 30-year-old woman married to Khamisi, who adds additional income to their family, and they are blessed with two children. Joyce has been operating a grocery stall for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Joyce was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000. She intends to use this amount to buy cabbages, carrots, potatoes, peas, kale, and oranges to sell to her customers daily.

Joyce plans to use the anticipated income to pay for school fees to her children, and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, potatoes, tomatoes, carrots, peas, kale, and oranges to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Marilou earns more income from raising pigs.

Marilou is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start horticultural farming

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is  aged 26 single, with no child, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He deals in a crafts and gift center, and earns an additional income from a mobile money business. He has been in that business for two years.

However, Leonard, faced with a challenge of limited capital, needs a loan  to buy crafts and gifts to sell. He has a dream of expanding his business to outside world.

loans.use: to buy crafts and gifts to sell.

loans.name: Phinah

texts.en:
Phinah is 38 years old and single with three children; they live in Kasese, Uganda.  

She practices agriculture, growing crops such as ground nuts, maize, and  beans for selling. Phinah started the business to get a daily source of income to support her family after divorcing from her husband.  She is hard-working; however, weather changes such as floods which destroy her plantations hinder her business. 

Phinah wants money to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and pay for labour

loans.name: Mariyan

texts.en:
Mariyan operates a grocery store, which is where she earns her income. She sells household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the 20,000 KES loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en: Zulekha appreciates the support of Kiva and Yehu.She has managed to educate her kids using Kiva loans, and she is happy that her kids will grow with knowledge.  Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to pay fees for her child, as schools are opening.  She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Hilda Omaira

texts.es:
Hilda, a sus 45 años de edad vive soltera y vive en el municipio de Medellín.

Ella comenzó a laborar en el campo de la confección, pues le colaboraba a una prima que tenía una empresa grande y allí se encargaba de pulir y revisar las prendas, cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad fue vinculada a la empresa, donde laboró por 4 años. 

Hace aproximadamente 3 años y con el apoyo de un hermano, Hilda se independizó y montó su taller, con mucha fe y con la esperanza de que las ventas aumentaran, comenzó a conseguir contratos con terceros y ahora le brinda empleo directo a una persona y 2 más, indirectos. De esta forma ha obtenido los ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
 
Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar una maquina recubridora, con el fin de brindarle a sus clientes una prenda bien elaborada y con excelente terminación, así aumentará los contratos y podrá generar mayores ingresos para poder cumplir el sueño de tener una marca propia y una línea de ropa interior y blusas para dama, y brindar oportunidades de empleo a otras  personas. 

Además, podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hilda is 45 years old, single, and lives in the city of Medellín.

She started to work in the sewing profession because she used to help a cousin she had who owned a big business. Her job was finishing and inspecting the clothing. When she became an adult, she was connected to the business, where she worked for four years.  

About 3 years ago, and with her brother's help, Hilda went off on her own and opened a workshop. With a a lot of faith and hoping to increase sales, she  started getting contracts with third parties and now she provides employment directly to one person directly and 2 others indirectly. This is the way she gets income to support her family. 
 
With the loan she is asking for, she will buy a coverstitch machine in order to offer her customers a well made item of clothing with excellent finishing. This way, the contracts will increase and she will be able to generate more income to be able to make her dream come true to have her own brand and a line of underwear and blouses for women, as well as to offer employment opportunities to other people.

In addition, she will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch machine to improve production and obtain a better quality of life.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 27-year-old  single woman who is blessed with two children and has been operating a clothing business for a period of two years, earning an income of KES. 7,000 at the end of every month.

She came to know VisionFund Kenya through a marketing event and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000. She intends to use this amount to buy skirt suits, trouser suits, dresses, shorts, sweaters, and blouses to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Elizabeth plans to use the anticipated income open a boutique and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy dresses, skirt suits, trouser suits, blouses, shirts, and sweaters to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Priscilah

texts.en:
HELLO LENDERS! Meet Priscilah, a very hardworking, energetic mother of 2 lovely children. Priscilah resides in the Kerugoya area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming activities. 

Priscilah has been doing mixed farming for the past 19 years and through those years she has gathered so much experience with the techniques of farming. Through the income from farming she has been able to take care of her family and also provide the basic needs for her grandchildren. Priscilah is a very enterprising woman, and although she never got formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her family of a decent meal. 

The Kerugoya area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Priscilah feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Priscilah is very disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits she will be able to improve her living conditions and also secure the future of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Jostina

texts.en: Jostina is a 43 year-old married female.  She has four children and lives in Kasese- Uganda.  Jostina owns a textile shop majoring in Bitenge . She earns an additional income from a retail shop of general merchandise. She has been in that business for ten years. Jostina is a hardworking woman, though  faced with a threat of a high level of competition .She needs a loan to buy more bitenge for selling.

loans.use: to buy more bitenge for selling.

loans.name: Nimambo

texts.en:
Nimambo has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses. In addition, she owns a real estate business which gives her other income.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale..

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, ha mantenido su negocio en el mercado con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior, comenta que su trabajo es permanente, sus ingresos han mejorado un poco, los utiliza para cubrir los gastos familiares y el pago de su deuda.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar café en grano por mayor, lo procesará para posteriormente venderlo a sus clientes, José espera que su negocio tenga una larga vida para subsistir con su familia.
texts.en:
José has sustained his business with the help of previous loans. He notes that his business is well-established and that he's seen a slight increase in his income, which he uses to meet his family's needs and repay his debts. 

José has decided to apply for a new loan to purchase wholesale coffee beans that he'll process and then sell to his customers. José hopes to keep running this business for many years so that he can support his family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale coffee beans that he'll then process and sell to his customers.

loans.name: Nancy Carolina

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de campo y está en espera de su primer hijo. 

Ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos de engorde y huevos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para compras algunas gallinas ponedoras y de pollos de engorde.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y del hijo que viene en camino.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Nancy is a country woman who is expecting her first child. She has had to go through a lot of adversity in life. Nonetheless, she has had the strength to get ahead and continue progressing with her family.  

For a long time, she has wanted to open a business raising and selling broiler chickens and egg laying hens. That is why she is asking for a financial encouragement to buy some laying hens and broiler chickens. 

With this new business she will be able to generate income for her family, who are everything for her. She will be able to improve the quality of life for her husband and her child who is on the way. 

She will work every day to driver her business and make it a sustainable and profitable activity.  

Support this hardworking woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy hens and chicks to start her own business and ensure a good future for her child on the way.

loans.name: Jhoan

texts.es:
Jhoan es un joven de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos y apoyar a su familia con los gastos de su casa.

El monto un café internet y sala de videojuegos desde hace 2 años aprovechando los conocimientos y el gusto que tiene por los artículos tecnológicos, además de que está cursando octavo semestre de ingeniería en sistemas.

El tiene 20 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar algunos elementos como un Xbox, un tv y un computador. 

Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y generar empleo.
texts.en:
Jhoan is a young man with good ideas and a creative mind. He is always looking for activities to increase his income and support his family with the household expenses. He opened an internet cafe and video-games room two years ago taking advantage of his knowledge and his enjoyment of technology. He is also taking his 8th semester of Systems Engineering.

He is 20 years old and has every thing in place to face the challenges that life has prepared for him. He is requesting a loan to buy some components like an Xbox, a TV and a computer. With this money he will be able to invest in his business attracting more clients and making a positive impact on his profits. His big dream is to have a large internet cafe with good income that generates employment.

loans.use: a computer, a TV and an Xbox for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Xhylfatime

texts.en: Xhylfatime comes from an Ashkali community in Kosovo and is the mother of five children. As with most members of the community they live in, they are very poor and live in terrible conditions. In order to earn a living, she and her husband collect plastic and iron to sell for money. This is their main source of income and they have been doing this for a long time with their small tractor. Now, their tractor is damaged and worn from years of use and they don’t have any money to purchase a new one, so Xhylfatime is asking for a loan. This loan will enable them to purchase a small tractor, which will help them to earn a living and work more effectively and efficiently. She is very thankful and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support. She promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To purchase a new small tractor for her bussiness

loans.name: Ljiljana

texts.en: Liljana is a mother of one son. She is employed in a clinic doing administrative work while her husband works in an electrical company. Together they are also involved in an agricultural business, working hard each day planting different vegetables. Liljana would like to request a loan in order to purchase a small tractor to use for working the land. This would make things more effective and efficient, increasing their profit and income. She is very satisfied with this type of business and hopes in the future to be able to expand it even more. She hopes it will help them to improve their conditions and allow them to save money for the future. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor to use for working the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats to slaughter and sell to his customers.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
El señor Carlos es un campesino nacido y criado con los excelentes valores del campo, aprendió del cultivo y ganadería gracias a sus padres y tiene su propio negocio de producción de leche con los que lleva sustento para su hogar, es casado y con su pareja tiene 3 hijos de 17, 13, 10 años los cuales tienen sus sueños en la vida ser veterinario, arquitecto, futbolista, sueños que no son difíciles de alcanzar y Carlos trabaja incansablemente para que ellos puedan estudiar la profesión que les apasiona.
Buscando un mejor futuro y mejorar su negocio Carlos quiere solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de una vaca lechera mejorando su producción y permitiéndose rotar más sus vacas para no acosarlas.
Su objetivo es tener más recursos para apoyar a sus hijos en las proyecciones de vida que tienen.
texts.en:
Carlos is a farmer who was born and raised with the excellent values of the countryside. He learned about crops and raising animals from his parents and has his own business producing milk which sustains his family. He is married and with his wife he has three children, aged 10, 13 and 17 years old.

They dream of becoming a veterinarian, an architect and a football player, dreams which are not hard to reach. Carlos will work without stop so that they can study the profession that fascinate them. Looking for a better future and to improve his business Carlos is requesting a loan to invest in buying a milk cow to increase his production and allow him to rotate his cows more and not bother them. His objective is to have more resources to support his children with their promising future.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to increase his production.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a married mother of two children, all of whom go to school . They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor running water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Esha dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Faviola

texts.es: Faviola tiene un hijo y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad y cuenta con luz, agua y alcantarillado Faviola trabaja como empleada en un banco pero tambien ofrece en sus ratos libres productos naturales (tiene como clientes a sus compañeros de trabajo, amigos y conocidos de sus familiares) El credito lo necesita para comprar alpiste, linaza y chia al por mayor Faviola es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Faviola has a son and lives in La Paz in a house made of bricks and cement that she owns. It has electricity, water and sewage services. Faviola works as an employee in a bank but also in her spare time offers natural products to her clients (fellow bank employees, friends and acquaintances of the family). She needs the loan to buy canary grass, linseed and chia seeds wholesale. Faviola is the only source of income for her family and she is in good health and needs your support.

loans.use: to buy canary grass, linseed and chia seeds.

loans.name: Carlos Noel

texts.es:
Para Carlos Noel, su amor por el ganado y lo relacionado al cultivo inició desde muy pequeño. Siempre se le veía atento a los animales, proporcionándoles el cuido necesario para su buen desarrollo, de igual manera con las plantas de su casa y las de sus vecinos. Por esta razones decidió estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, cursa su quinto año y anhela conseguir un trabajo donde pueda poner a prueba todos sus conocimientos. Tiene 30 años, su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, son quienes lo motivan a cumplir sus metas. Es un joven emprendedor, aparte de estudiar, trabaja como mesero, lo que le ayuda en su economía familiar. 
Él solicita el crédito para poder pagar los trámites del título de su carrera, Ingeniería Agropecuaria. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que con un título universitario obtendrá mejores ofertas de trabajo, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones de vida y así podrá ofrecerles a sus hijos salud y educación de calidad. Entre sus planes futuros está seguir estudiando, obtener títulos de posgrados y maestrías, lo que sea necesario para reforzar su curriculum profesional. Es un hombre soñador, con muchos ánimos de progresando y ser de mucho apoyo para el desarrollo de su país.
texts.en:
Thirty-year old Carlos Noel - a husband, father of two, and young entrepreneur - has loved ranching and farming since early childhood. He has always had a great interest in animals, providing them the care they need for healthy growth. Carlos Noel has always devoted the same close attention to his family's and his neighbors' plants. He therefore decided to enroll in an Agricultural Engineering program and is now in his fifth year. Carlos Noel hopes to find work that will allow him to use all that he's learned about farming and ranching. His children are his inspiration to meet his goals, and he's working as a waiter to support his family when he's not studying. 

Carlos Noel is applying for a loan in order pay the fees related to obtaining his university degree in Agricultural Engineering. These credentials will lead to more job offers, allowing Carlos Noel to improve his standard of living and provide his children with quality health and education. Carlos Noel hopes to continue his studies of Agricultural Engineering, obtain a graduate degree, and improve his qualifications. He is an ambitious young man, with great hopes of improving his situation and making a substantial contribution to his country's development.

loans.use: to pay fees related to obtaining his university degree in Agricultural Engineering.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Nicolas,  tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, junto a su esposa trabajan en la agricultura, sus hijos estudian en colegios del municipio de mizque, recientemente construyo su casa para brindarles una mejor comodidad a sus hijos en ella invirtió todo su dinero. El señor trabaja arduamente para sacar a su familia adelante, también trabaja de jornalero para ganar dinero extra y así mantener y cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos. Ahora está solicitando un crédito para comprar semilla de papa, agroquímicos y otros insumos, de esta manera aumentara su producción y lograr mejorar su economía y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Nicolas is 35 years old, married and has four children. He and his wife work in agriculture.  His children attend school in the town of Mizque. In order to make his children more comfortable, he recently built his own house and invested all of his money in that project.

Nicolas works hard to help his family get ahead. He also works as a day laborer in order to earn extra money and thus support his family and cover his children’s education expenses.

He is soliciting a loan at this time to purchase potato seed, agrochemicals and other supplies. In this way he will increase production and manage to improve his finances and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase potato seed, agrochemicals and other supplies.

loans.name: Bano

texts.en:
Bano is a 43-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one cow and two buffaloes which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Bano has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. 

Bano is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de femmes de Hamdallaye qui se connaissent bien car elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et ont au moins 4enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, d’Habillement, bois de chauffage  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe.
Natenin est un membre du groupe Danaya,2ème personne assise de gauche à droite, vendeuse de Pagnes, Bazin. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de pièces de pagnes et de Bazin en qualité de toute couleur qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Danaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Natenin compte réaliser  180 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Danaya Group brings together women from Hamdallaye who all know each other rather well, as they live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. On average, each member is 30 years old and has at least four children. This group of women sells various items, such as clothing and firewood. In order to expand the scale of their businesses, the members decided to sign up for the Soro Yiriwaso lending scheme. This will be their sixth group loan.

Natenin is a member of the Danaya Group. In the photo, she is the woman who is sat second from the left. She sells pagne cloth and sheets of damask. She plans on using this loan to purchase different-coloured pagne and damask cloth, which she will then resell to her customers. She gets her supplies from the main market. Whereas other Danaya Group members are planning on making an average profit of 150,000 FCFA over the course of their loan cycles, Natenin is planning on earning 180,000 FCFA. 

In addition to paying back their loans, they use part of the revenue to pay for their personal expenses and increase their business assets.

They wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that their stock never runs low.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: María de 47 años de edad, desde hace 15 años posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos productos y los buenos precios, Maria vive con un hijo y su esposo en casa propia, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería para la tienda como: gaseosas, golosinas, azúcar, aceites, sal, huevos etc. por mayor para poder surtir con mas productos su tienda, obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: María is 47 years old. For 15 years she has had a small store located in her residence. She has a lot of customers because of her good products and prices. Maria lives with a son and her husband in her own house. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for the store, such as sodas, snacks, sugar, oils, salt, eggs, etc., to stock more products in her store, obtain more income and give her family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy sodas, snacks, sugar, oil, salt, eggs, etc., wholesale.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Cette femme  fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le 18 septembre 2010. Ce banc regroupe des membres du même village et ceux des alentours. La plupart de ces femmes font du commerce et de l’embouche.
Khady âgée de 54 ans est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 2 filles. 
Elle envisage faire avec le prêt de l’embouche bovine. Elle va acheter un bœuf qu'elle va élever elle même pendant six mois. Après élevage elle va le revendre au marché hebdomadaire de la zone.
Avec les bénéfices, elle va aider son mari dans la prise en charge familiale
texts.en:
This woman is a member of the banc villageois which was created on 18th September 2010. The members of this banc live in the same village and its surrounding areas. Most of these women work as vendors and livestock farmers.

Khady is a 54-year-old married mother to four sons and two daughters.

She plans on using this loan to fund her cattle farming business. She will buy a cow which she herself with raise for six months. After raising it, she will then resell it at her local weekly market.

She will use the profits to assist her husband with their family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Blanca Melva

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer muy emprendedora y buscadora de oportunidades que siempre se levanta de cualquier dificultad y lucha por los suyos. Tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos vive sola con ellos pues se separó de su esposo pro problemas que prefiere no mencionar para no recordar malos momentos. 

Tiene un restaurante en la ciudad de Medellín es ayudada por una persona y trabaja felizmente, muy tranquila produciendo su propio sustento, sus comidas son reconocidas pues cualquiera persona cocina pero no cualquiera tiene un toque de sabor que hace que sus clientes vuelvan. 

Su restaurantes es muy básico, tiene solo lo importante mesas, sillas y una cocina para cocinar los alimentos y ella quiere progresar pues sabe que si se queda en lo mismo no perdurara en el tiempo. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos buscando retener sus ganancias para mejorar el local, tener mejores mesas una mejor presentación y ampliar la carta ofreciendo más preparaciones de platos por lo que el crédito le permitirá hacer todas estas movidas al tiempo. 

Sueña con ver su negocio muy bien organizado, con mejores insumos, mayores preparaciones que seguro el traerán un mejor volumen de clientes para perdurar y seguir llevando el sustento a su familia la cual levanto sola.
texts.en:
Blanca is a very enterprising woman who searches for opportunities to get out of any difficulty and fight for her family. She is 51 years old and is the mother of three children. She lives alone with them as she is separated from her husband because of problems that she doesn't want to mention it as it evokes bad memories.

She has a restaurant in the city of Medellin where she works happily and is very content to be making her own sustenance. She has help from a worker. Her meals are well-known as anybody can cook but not everyone has the touch with taste that makes her clients return.

Her restaurant is very basic, it only has tables, chairs and a kitchen to cook her food. She wants to make progress but she knows that if she doesn't she is not wasting her time. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies looking to save her profits to improve her business with better tables a nicer appearance and expanding the menu.

The loan will allow her to make all these moves in time. She dreams of having a well organized business, with better supplies, better preparation that certainly will bring a greater volume of clients to eat and continue to generate the sustenance for her family that she must do on her own.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en: With your financial help, Lindita built a storage room to dry out agricultural products like onions, potatoes and beans, and she's very appreciative to all of her lenders. Lindita is back now wanting your help again. This time around she wants to invest in a dairy cow and hopes that lenders will help her achieve the goal.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Fiza

texts.en: Fiza is a 42-year-old married woman with 2 children.  She has been running a milk selling business for the last 10 years. She looks after the buffaloes; performing the task of collecting milk which she sells at different places on a daily basis. In this way, she receives decent profits. She uses the income to support her family. In order to increase her profits, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes that this loan will help in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Zikkaoy

texts.ru:
Зиккаой 49-летняя жительница города Душанбе. Она замужем, ее муж работает электриком. Сама Зиккаой работает уборщицей на киностудии "Таджик фильм". Ей в работе помогает ее младшая дочь. У Зиккаой трое дочерей и сын. Сын занимается ювелирным делом. Зиккаой работает уборщицей, так как у нее нет высшего образования. Она работает в этой должности уже три года. 
Целью запрашиваемого кредита - является ремонт дома. Дело в том, что уже несколько лет их дом не видел ремонта. Зиккаой хочет улучшить жилищные условия и хорошо подготовиться к зиме. Для этой цели ей не хватает всего лишь 1000 долларов США. Она очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Zikkaoy is a 49-year-old resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is married and her husband works as an electrician. Zikkaoy doesn't have a higher education and so for three years she has been working as a janitor at the Tajik Film movie studio, work her younger daughter helps her with. Zikkaoy has three daughters and one son. Her son has a jewellery business. 

The intent of this loan is home renovations, since for several years they haven't done any work to the house. Zikkaoy wants to improve her family's living conditions and be well-prepared for winter. She is lacking just $1,000 USD for this goal. She very much hopes for support.

loans.use: to renovate her home and improve her living conditions

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
Con una sonrisa en el rostro inicia el día de trabajo para María Estela, una mujer que ha trabajado arduamente para que sus dos negocios, tanto el de la venta de nacatamales como el de la venta se cosméticos sigan adelante y así fortalecer la economía familiar. Ella se muestra agradecida con el financiamiento de Kiva a través de MiCrédito, ya que gracias a este logró incrementar su producción, lo que le permitió satisfacer la demanda de su clientela y al mismo tiempo mejorar las condiciones de su negocio. Es una mujer emprendedora con 31 años de edad y un esposo que le brinda apoyo incondicional, no tienen hijos, pero está en sus planes tenerlos. 
Con ánimos de seguir prosperando y que sus negocios continúen prosperando, María solicita otro crédito para invertir en su negocio de venta de cosméticos, requiere comprar maquillaje, así como rubor, bases, delineador, rímel, sombras, entre otros; también cremas para limpieza facial e hidratantes. Anhela seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su hogar, razón por la que deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, al mismo tiempo, desea incrementar el número de su clientela ya que le va a permitir aumentar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María Estela begins each workday with a smile on her face.  She is a woman who works hard so that her two business, one selling nacatamales, as well as the other selling cosmetics, will continue succeeding so that she can increase household income.

She is grateful for Kiva funding through MiCrédito since, thanks to it, she managed to increase production. This enabled her to meet her customers’ demands and at the same time improve her business conditions. 

She is an enterprising 31-year-old woman with a husband who supports her unconditionally.  They do not have children yet, however they plan to have them in the future.

With the aim that she and her businesses continue to thrive, María is requesting another loan to invest in her cosmetics selling business. She needs to purchase blush, foundation, eyeliner, mascara and eyeshadow, among other item, as well as facial cleansing and moisturizing creams.

She wants to continue improving the infrastructure of her home, which is another reason why she places her trust in financing. At the same time, she wants to increase her customer base because it will enable her to increase her income. This will allow her to have better living conditions.

loans.use: o purchase blush, foundation, eyeliner, mascara and eyeshadow, among other item, as well as facial cleansing and moisturizing creams.

loans.name: Hector Jose

texts.es:
L señor Héctor toda su vida había trabajado en el campo, desempeñándose como ayudante o asistente de cultivo, tuvo gran experiencia tanto así que fue llamado de otro municipio a trabajar en una empresa cultivadora de flores. 

Por crisis la empresa tuvo que cerrar quedando desempleado y con su hermano tuvo la iniciativa de montar un negocio una cafetería donde juntos han logrado mantenerla por más de 9 años ofreciendo servicios de comidas rápidas, tintos, pericos, dulces, gaseosas, snacks.

Su idea es seguir progresando son muy trabajadores, tanto así que el negocio lo tienen abierto pro más de 15 horas diariamente en la mañana como cafetería y más tarde en la noche ofertar sus servicios de comidas rápidas.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido compraran carne, papas, café, panes, ensalada, frutas, carnes frías, dulces, snacks, que le permitirá seguir progresando y darles gusto de trabajar que es su gran pasión. 

Héctor es padre de un hijo de 20 años del cual se siente muy orgulloso pues nada más gratificante que darle la oportunidad de estudiar realizar grandes esfuerzos para que pueda estar en la universidad y que le devuelva con buenas notas su esfuerzo pro lo que quiere seguir creciendo para seguir pagándole sus estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
All his life, Hector worked on farms, in the role of helper or assistant manager. He had lots of experience, and as a result, he was called to another municipality to work in an enterprise the cultivated flowers. 

But due to a crisis, the enterprise was forced to close, leaving Hector and his brother unemployed. The two brothers then took the initiative to start a cafeteria business and together, they have managed to maintain it for more than 9 years, offering services including fast food, red wine, coffee with milk, sweets, soft drinks, and snacks.

Hector's goal is to continue progressing. They are very hard workers, so much so that they keep the business open 15 hours a day; mornings as a coffee shop and evenings offering fast food services.

Hector is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as meat, potatoes, coffee, bread, salad, fruit, frozen meat, sweets, and snacks, which will allow them to continue progressing and offer them the pleasure of working, which is their grand passion.

Hector is the father of a 20-year-old son he is very proud of, and nothing gives him greater pleasure than to offer his son the opportunity to study and make the great effort to study at the university and bring home good grades. Hector wants to continue expanding so that he can continue paying for his son's studies.

loans.use: buy a selection of meats, potatoes, coffee, bread, salad, fruit, frozen meat, sweets, and snacks to sell, permitting him to continue paying for his son's studies.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 51-year-old married woman running a business of milk selling for many years. She sells the milk in her neighborhood. Her business is doing well enough to give her a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with good education, food and clothing. It’s her 6th year with Kashf Foundation. Now, Razia has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing higher living standards to her family.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Дилмурод вырос в многодетной крестьянской семье. Их было 8 детей. Отец был инвалидом и имел небольшую торговую лавку. Вся семейная тяжесть легла на его мать. Для того чтобы прокормить своих детей, его мать работала и уборщицей и сторожем и наемным работником. У Дилмурода не было возможности учиться в университете и получить высшее образование. Он в течение 8 лет был трудовым мигрантом в Российской Федерации. Данное время он у себя на Родине и занимается строительством домов. Он имеет 2 детей. Его сыну 20 лет и он женат. Его дочери 18 лет. Она в этом году окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Педагогический университет. Дилмурод запрашивает займ на сумму 450 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Dilmurod grew up in a big rural family as one of eight children. His father was disabled and had a small shop. The family depended on his mother, who worked several jobs to feed her children: as a cleaner, as a caretaker and as a hired labourer. Dilmurod didn't have the opportunity to get a university education. For eight years, he worked as a migrant labourer in Russia. Now he is living at home again and working in home construction. He has two children - a 20-year-old son who is married, and an 18-year-old daughter who just graduated from high school and has entered university to become a teacher. Dilmurod is requesting a loan of $450 USD to pay her tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar to her fellow neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

She appreciates the previous loan which helped her to buy food stuffs for sale. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 20,000. She wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Jenifer works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising livestock. Jenifer is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, egg, noodles, spices, etc., for her general store business.

Jenifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, egg, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married with six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 43 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mélida Gladis

texts.es:
Mélida tiene 62 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado en su comunidad, tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad y viven aparte por lo tanto ella vive sola.

Mélida trabaja de costurera, hace todo tipo de vestuario, ella aprendió este oficio desde que tenía 18 años de edad. Cuando tuvo su primer hijo se dio cuenta que debía buscar una fuente de ingresos y decidió dedicarse a la costura.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar madera para ponerle techo a una pequeña sala que ha construido, en la cual planea montar su taller de confección.

El sueño de Mélida es tener salud para seguir en su negocio, incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mélida is 62 years old, and studied until the sixth grade in her community.  She has three adult children who live separately from her, and she therefore lives alone.

Mélida works as a seamstress, and does all types of clothing.  She learned this trade when she was 18 years old.  When she had her first child, she realized that she had to find a source of income and decided to work sewing.

She needs this loan to purchase wood to put a roof on a small room she has built, in which she plans to set up her tailoring workshop.

Mélida's dream is to have good health to continue her business, increase her income and improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase wood to put a roof on a small room she has built, in which she plans to set up her tailoring workshop.

loans.name: Zyhra

texts.en:
Zyra wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan. She used the loan to renovate her stable. Her husband is still working as a cook in a restaurant and she is involved in her agricultural work. 

She has managed to add two more cows to her stable, which she is very happy about. With these additional cows, she will now be able to sell more milk and dairy products in her neighborhood, adding more income for her family. Because she was very satisfied with the first loan, she is now requesting a second loan to further expand her stable to accommodate her new cows. She promises to pay again on time and thanks all of the lenders for their support, helping her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To further expand her stable to accommodate her new cows

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store for a period of about 2 years. She also purchases stock of goods from the market. She has been able to earn a healthy income from this store. Nusrat is in her 5th loan cycle. She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy eatables such as oil, beverages, salts, tea, packed milk, and also other items such as shampoo, spray, etc. Her dream is to expand her store and provide a better living standard to her family with the additional income.

loans.use: to buy eatables such as oil, beverages, salts, tea, packed milk, and also other items such as shampoo, spray, etc.

loans.name: Barkat  Unisa

texts.en: Barkat Unisa is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 2 children.  She is a very dedicated mother.
