She started providing the service of tailoring to her community few years ago with the aim of providing a better living standard to her children. She is known for her good quality sewing skills around her locality. Her main customers are her neighbors and the people living nearby. In her 4th loan cycle, Barkat Unisa has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good life and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 53-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Naseem has one year of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Naseem is the mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, grains, sugar and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. Naseem is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, grains, sugar and beverages

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 35-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough income to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 45,000 PKR.  She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, grains and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to consistently meet increasing demand. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shelves, display cabinets and raw material to start up her bakery business in the area and to be close to her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

She operates a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000  loan, Mariamu wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar for use in food preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar

loans.name: Luz Aleida

texts.es:
Luz, con 21 años de edad, se ha dedicado por algunos años a vender mercancía por encargo y productos por catálogos, de manera alterna, inicio con una pequeña tienda en el municipio donde reside; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante sus estudios.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto la impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar surtido de productos de la canasta familiar, como granos, bebidas, entre otros, así podrá abastecer su micro negocio y le dará ese impulso que tanto necesita para progresar.

Luz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio ubicado en el centro del municipio de El Carmen de Viboral para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
21 year-old Luz has made a living for several years alternating between selling merchandise on commission and products from catalogues. She started off with a small shop in the town she lives in; this is how she adds to the income which has allowed her to get ahead with her studies.

Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to fight tirelessly, always in search of a way to get ahead; this is what is pushing her to ask for a loan to buy products to stock as part of families' basic needs allowance, such as seeds, drinks, among other things. She will therefore be able to stock her small business and give it the kick-start it so needs to progress.

Luz states that her greatest wish is to obtain her own property located in the town centre of El Carmen de Viboral, in order to set up her business and make it more profitable, so that she might then guarantee economic stability to contribute towards a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic products for families' basic needs to stock her small shop and give it a good kick-start.

loans.name: Shaheena

texts.en:
Shaheena, age 50, is married and has two children. She has been running a school for many years to pay for her household expenditures. She has gained a good number of students and is respected in her community. Shaheena contributes much to the family income through all of her great efforts. 

In order to accommodate more students in her school, Shaheena has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase a couple of school benches and chairs, as well as a new blackboard. She expects more admissions as her school becomes well-known in her town. Shaheena desires to spend part of the revenues on the expansion of her school.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of school benches and chairs and a new blackboard.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is a 32-year-old married woman doing a business of selling milk for the past 10 years. She has one buffalo in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to let her lead a decent life.

She has two children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s her 4th year with Kashf Foundation; Sumera is happily running her business through its support. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to increase her production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra, age 31, is a married woman. She is expert in embroidery. She makes beautiful-looking embroidery on clothes. Her clients are based in her community and from nearby areas. She makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR. It will allow her to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of beads, pearls and needles. She is in her 9th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of beads, pearls and needles.

loans.name: Anwer

texts.en:
Anwer is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. 

She has been running a small general store in her area with the help of her husband. Over time, the customer base of her store has greatly increased. With the help of income from this store, Anwer has been able to provide her family with good quality food and clothing. She is in her fourth loan cycle with Kashf foundation and has good repayment history. 

Anwer has now requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. With this loan, she wants to buy stock of oil, spices, tea, jams, packed juices, etc., to meet the increasing demand in her store. She has high hopes of a rise in income, which she wants to spend on the health and education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of oil, spices, tea, jams, packed juices etc.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: Angélica tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 2 años y 7 años de edad. Ella es muy trabajadora y visionaria quien desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de cocos y jugo de caña. Con su habilidad para los negocios ha logrado ganarse la confianza de sus clientes y cada día la prefieren más. Angélica ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dado que tal como se muestra en la fotografía las paredes se encuentran en mal estado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, lámina, arena, ladrillo, hierro, polines y además pagará mano de obra para la construcción del cuarto.
texts.en: Angélica is 27 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and her two daughters, who are 2 and 7 years old. She is very hard-working and a visionary, who for the last 4 years has been making a living selling coconuts and sugar-cane juice. With her business ability she has succeeded in gaining her customers' trust, and they favour her more and more. Angélica has made the decision to ask for a loan from FUSAI to invest in building a room, because as you can see in the picture, the walls are in bad condition. Furthermore, she is asking FUSAI for a loan in order to invest in buying cement, metal sheets, sand, bricks, iron, idlers, and on top of that she will pay less for manpower to build this room.

loans.use: to buy: cement, metal sheets, sand, bricks, iron, idlers  and on top of that she will pay less for manpower to build the room.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is a hard working married woman. She has 5 children. 

For the last 10 years, she has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skill of stitching. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. In her 4th loan cycle, Akhtar has requested for a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread, laces and buttons. 

Akhtar is very thankful for her previous loans and hopes that this loan will generate a healthy source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, laces, and buttons.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Forty-seven years old Nusrat is a married woman and a mother of two children. The only source of earning in her family is the rickshaw that her husband, also shown in the picture, drives. This rickshaw helps them provide transportation service in their city to passengers. 

Nusrat has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown very good repayment behaviour. This loan amount will help her husband to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw. She expects a boost in her husband’s income.

loans.use: to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw.

loans.name: Radhiya

texts.en:
Radhiya is married with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a juice selling business, selling at home and at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality as fruits are harvested in a specific season.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Radhiya wants to purchase a variety of fruits, i.e., mangoes, bananas, and pawpaws, for preparation of juice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits, i.e., mangoes, bananas, and pawpaws, for preparation of juice for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is married and the father of five children. He operates a construction business where he builds houses. He has been in this line of work for four years and describes his biggest business challenge as the fluctuating price of tools. He will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy tools, and hopes that in the future, he will own a matatu or minibus. He will use the profits he expects to earn to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy construction tools

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en: Sharifan is a 52-year-old married woman. In order to help her husband take care of their family, she went into the business of selling milk and is now  known in her town for providing good-quality milk. She owns two cows and one buffalo, and is happily helping support her family with the income she earns. She is in her fifth loan cycle, and is requesting a loan for 40,000 PKR to buy another buffalo. She hopes that increased milk production will help her generate more income.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Gulfreen

texts.en:
Gulfreen is a 44-year-old married woman who has 2 children. She is a hardworking lady. For the past 9 months, Gulfreen has been running a beauty parlor business. She offers a number of services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, hair treatments and facials. Gulfreen has a strong customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Gulfreen has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of hair care and styling products, skin whitening and cleansing products, manicure and pedicure tools, etc. to attract more customers and expand her business. Gulfreen expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of hair care and styling products, skin whitening and cleansing products, manicure and pedicure tools, etc.

loans.name: Pukhraj

texts.en: Pukhraj is a 49-year-old woman who initiated her milk sales business. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, Pukhraj  has gradually improved her business. She has currently requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. Pukhraj  is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Lachman

texts.en: Lachman, 46 years old, lives with his wife and father. He farms rice on a plot of 8 hectares which was formerly owned by his father. Lachman also works as a driver for a merchant. Two years ago, Lachman bought a tractor with the support of Seva MFI. His loans are always repaid fully and on time. Lachman is asking Seva MFI for another loan of SRD 7,000 for overhauling his tractor so he can work better and have lots of profit to save for his future.

loans.use: to overhaul his tractor.

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en: Colleta is married and the mother of two children. She describes herself as determined, and operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been in this business for seven years, and works from a good location where she sells to the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds, and will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothing to sell. Her goal is to have a bigger stall where she can do her selling. She hopes to do this within the next five years, and is now requesting her first loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es una joven mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es el servicio de peluquería.
Ella es emprendedora, amable, comunicativa, persistente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Santiago II que se ha caracterizado por una fuerte tradición de autoorganización que se refleja en la existencia de las juntas vecinales que surgieron junto al establecimiento de las urbanizaciones.
Marcela es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su trabajo lo realiza en un salón de belleza propio, al cual desde el inicio le puso mucho trabajo, pasión y dedicación. El Local está ubicado en un área de su propia casa, Su Target son vecinos, amigos, y sobre todo aquellas personas que quieren verse y sentirse bellas, Los Servicios que ofrece son; Corte, peinado, color, depilación, uñas, tratamientos específicos, y para un futuro cercano quiere incluir masajes y aromaterapia de esta manera sus clientes entraran y saldrán como nuevos.
Su sueño es tener mayores ingresos económicos para poder apoyar a su familia. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de herramientas de trabajo para su salón de belleza.
Es por esos motivos que Marcela solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de salón de belleza y con los beneficios apoyar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Marcela is a young woman who is 22 years old, unmarried with no children. She has a hair salon business.

She is enterprising, friendly, communicative, persistent, responsible and very hard working. She runs her business in the Santiago II area, which has been characterized by a strong tradition of self-organization that is reflected in the existence of neighborhood councils that emerged with the establishment of housing developments.

Marcela is medium height and brown skinned with long black hair. Her native tongue is Aymara and she uses Spanish in business. She works in a beauty salon that she owns, a business into which she has poured all of her passion and dedication. 

Her salon is located in her own house and she has targeted her neighbors and friends and those who want to feel and look beautiful. The services she offers are: cutting, hairstyling, coloring, waxing, nails and specific treatments and in the near future she wants to include massage and aromatherapy. Thus her clients will come and leave like new.

Her dream is to earn more income to support her family. She wants to expand her business through the purchase of work equipment for her beauty salon.

It is for these reasons that Marcela is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for her beauty salon so that she can support her family financially with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail business selling chickens. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a vibrant location, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of capital. He will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more chickens. He hopes that in the future he will buy land and build. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Fabio Alberto

texts.es:
Fabio es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su tienda de abarrotes en zona rural del municipio de El Carmen De Viboral.

Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del sector que siempre prefieren visitar su tienda para adquirir sus productos.

Todos los días trabaja para darles una buena calidad de vida  a sus 2 hijos menores por los cuales aspira a darles un excelente futuro.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como granos, abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su negocio, adicionalmente comprara un enfriador.

El guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Fabio is a very friendly person and always has a smile for the customers who visit his grocery store in the rural area of the municipality of El Carmen De Viboral.  Thanks to his charisma and good attitude he has been able to win over his customers' hearts and gain the recognition of the people of the area who always prefer to visit his store to purchase their goods.

He works every day in order to give a good quality of life to his two young children, to whom he aspires to give an excellent future.

He is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of an assortment of basic goods such as grains, groceries, sweets, and drinks, among other goods, which will give a significant boost to his business.  Additionally, he will buy a cooler.

He keeps the hope of being able to continue on with his business and in this way continue impacting his customers' lives through good service.

loans.use: to purchase assorted goods for his business such as groceries, grains, soda, fried foods, liquors and other food products.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has 4 children. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Jackline describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

She will use the anticipated profits to open a retail shop.

loans.use: buy farm inputs.
